items.title: Conference | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: Explore what's next in the worlds of tech, film, music, culture, and beyond across a variety of formats at the SXSW Conference.
items.content: SXSW Conference March 7-13, 2025 The SXSW Conference provides an opportunity for the global community of creatives to encounter cutting-edge ideas, discover new interests, and network with other professionals who share a similar appetite for forward-focused experiences. 2025 Conference Schedule Keynote: Breaking Barriers, Shaping Narratives: How Women Lead On and Off the Screen ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Virginia Hernandez Featuring a variety of tracks that focus on the most important breakthroughs in technology, film, culture, and music, SXSW proves that the most unexpected discoveries happen when diverse topics and people come together. See You at SXSW 2025 Join us for SXSW 2025 from March 7‚Äì15 in Austin, TX. Register and book your hotel today! Stay tuned for announcements throughout the season by subscribing to Event Updates and community newsletters. Buy Your Badge Ita√∫ is the official 2025 SXSW Streaming Sponsor for Conference Keynotes and Featured Sessions, offering digital translation services in Spanish & Portuguese. Fifth Round of Keynotes and Featured Speakers More More More! The final round of keynote and featured speakers is here for the 39th edition of the SXSW Conference. Ben Stiller, Eddy Cue, Ayanna Pressley, Bryan Johnson and many many more! Check the Announcement! Conference Announcements Catch up on the latest Conference announcements for SXSW 2025 across 23 diverse tracks of programming. Read All About It SXSW Timeline March 7-15, 2025 Plan your SXSW 2025 adventure today! Explore primary access per badge type across daily programming including Conference tracks, Festivals, and Exhibitions. Download PDF 2050 (March 7-10) The 2050 track focuses on long-term, big-picture thinking with an emphasis on scientific discovery. The programming features topics ranging from quantum computing and space exploration to robotics and foresight best practices ‚Äî and beyond. 2050 Track Advertising & Brand Experience (March 7-11) Geared towards agencies and organizations that want to strengthen connections with their communities and clients, this programming features effective approaches to brand strategy as well as novel methods of engaging audiences through traditional and digital marketing practices. Advertising & Brand Experience Track Artificial Intelligence (March 9-13) The rise of artificial intelligence introduced a new era of technological innovation. Alongside its rapid growth have come questions about responsibility, capability, and impact. This track explores not only technological advancements but also the numerous implications that continued adoption will have on society. Artificial Intelligence Track Climate & Sustainability (March 10-13) Explore the most promising, solution-based innovations and strategies to mitigate climate change. From sustainable building solutions to cutting-edge climate technologies, learn how you can help in the fight to end climate change and build a sustainable future for generations to come. Climate & Sustainability Track Creating Film & TV (March 7-11) Join us to explore the creative and collaborative process of making films and television shows. Learn practical tips to bring your ideas to life on screen, and stay up-to-date with the latest tech developments. Topics range from screenwriting and nonfiction storytelling to virtual production and workshops on post-production. Creating Film & TV Track Creator Economy (March 7-11) An estimated 1 in 4 people worldwide contribute to the creator economy, the fastest growing type of small business today. This programming explores that dynamic landscape of self-produced content for creators, their collaborators, and their communities. Discover innovative strategies for audience building and monetization, and gain insights into the future of this booming industry. Creator Economy Track Culture (March 7-13) The Culture track spotlights the fusion of creativity, humanity, and arts, offering a fresh perspective on how communities uniquely share their stories. Delve into diverse and dynamic topics and speakers that shape our collective experiences. Culture Track Design (March 7-11) In the space between creativity and technicality lies the Design track. These sessions traverse a wide expanse of topics from accessible spaces and what makes them work, to the UX of our newest tools, to visual trends and their applications. Design Track Energy (March 7-9) From renewable energy breakthroughs to smart grid solutions, the Energy track illuminates the latest trends shaping the future of how we power the world. Whether it‚Äôs showcasing clean tech advancements or examining the evolving landscape of energy policy, sessions will highlight action towards a more sustainable future and solutions to production and delivery at every scale. Energy Track Fashion & Beauty (March 7-9) These sessions dive into the lifecycle of products, exploring the latest trends and advancements in research, design, and manufacturing. From eco-friendly materials to efficient logistics and mindful retail strategies, this track analyzes how these industries shape our lives. Fashion & Beauty Track Film & TV Industry (March 7-11) Prepare for a unique overview of the industry through the lens of independent filmmaking. Uncover new practices in financing and distribution, and discover emerging trends that will help you navigate the ever-evolving world of the Film & TV Industry. Film & TV Industry Track Food (March 8-10) Food has the ability to connect cultures and bridge the gap between communities across the globe. The Food track brings chefs, entrepreneurs, activists, farmers, scientists and enthusiasts together to explore ways in which technology and innovation can be leveraged to change the way we grow, cook and consume food to create a more sustainable and healthier world. Food Track Game Industry (March 9-11) Unlock the future of entertainment with our Game Industry track, spotlighting the explosive growth of the gaming industry as the ultimate entertainment platform. Dive into how music content and diverse media are seamlessly integrating into these immersive systems, transforming the gaming experience and redefining media consumption. Game Industry Track Government & Civic Engagement (March 7-10) Functional government and civic engagement are imperative to ensure that everyone‚Äôs voices and needs are understood in today‚Äôs complicated societies. This track covers a myriad of topics that help shape a more positive, equitable, and engaging world. Government & Civic Engagement Track Health & MedTech (March 7-11) Situated at the crossroads of science and technology, Health & MedTech sessions explore everything from the newest weight loss drugs to the impact of differentiated stem cell technology on neuroscience, as well as the solutions and tools that provide better outcomes for patients everywhere. Health & MedTech Track Music & Tech (March 10-13) From artificial intelligence in music production and virtual reality music videos to immersive live entertainment, technology has re-invented the way we create, discover, distribute and experience music. The Music & Tech track showcases the promises and potential pitfalls of these innovations and trends. Music & Tech Track Music Industry (March 10-13) The Music Industry track covers a wide range of topics across music, from publishing and sync to marketing and touring. Whether you‚Äôre an emerging artist or a seasoned industry vet, this track will provide valuable guidance and insight into this ever-changing landscape. Music Industry Track Psychedelics (March 8-10) It‚Äôs time we expand our understanding of the profound potential of psychoactive substances. Hear from researchers, healthcare professionals, and investors who are working to dissolve the stigma, reshaping how we view and consume psychedelics. Come experience how we are bringing these centuries-old drugs into the mainstream. Psychedelics Track Startups (March 7-10) Be inspired, be motivated and be captivated by the successes and failures of a diverse array of founders, as well as the funders who backed their often unconventional entrepreneurial efforts. If you want to translate your great startup idea into a successful reality, then this track will give you a competitive advantage for the long adventure ahead. Startups Track Tech Industry (March 7-13) Showcasing the cutting-edge platforms, visionary leaders, advanced software, state-of-the-art hardware, and immersive virtual systems driving the next wave of technological innovation. The Tech industry‚Äôs areas of focus for 2025 include breakthrough advancements in cybersecurity, the evolving landscape of Big Tech, the transformative potential of Web3, and Austin's ascent as a pivotal global tech powerhouse. A highlight of SXSW, the Tech Industry track spans the entire eight-day conference. Tech Industry Track Transportation (March 11-13) New technology continues to transform the transportation ecosystem, driving a new era of connected, sustainable mobility, and enhanced passenger experience. Autonomous vehicles are making significant progress, with ride-hailing services, and delivery applications increasingly deployed in cities around the world. As EV sales are surging in Europe and parts of Asia, the U.S. market continues to face challenges in the form of fluctuating demand, charging infrastructure, and supply-chain headaches. Meanwhile, climate-conscious solutions for the aviation industry are gaining traction and attention at a rapid pace. The Transportation track content is geared toward understanding the latest trends and best new ideas on how to move people and products from here to there. Transportation Track Workplace (March 7-10) Guiding employees and employers through various stages of career development, the Workplace track seeks to focus on how organizations can work together to drive innovation, inspire growth and be adaptable so everyone can reach their goals. Workplace Track XR (March 9-11) Immersive technology has been a constantly evolving medium used across both enterprise applications and entertainment. Sessions in the XR track explore how these exciting technologies are being implemented across multiple industries and how they can affect larger audiences. XR Track Keynotes Daily keynotes present diverse, visionary speakers with powerful new ideas in the ever-evolving worlds of tech, film, culture, and music. Featured Speakers Spanning the many tracks of the Conference, Featured Speakers present a snapshot of the ideas that can most transform our future. Formats Conference programming offers a variety of formats to sharpen your career skills and network with creatives from around the world. items.description: Explore SXSW Festivals: immerse yourself in Film & TV, Music, and Comedy through showcases, screenings, special events, and more.
items.content: Festivals SXSW Festivals offer a unique opportunity to explore the worlds of Film & TV, Music, and Comedy with parties, awards, screenings, showcases, and special events. The Black Keys ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Aaron Rogosin Film & TV Festival For nine days in March, creatives of all stripes gather for the acclaimed Film & TV Festival program. Running concurrently with the SXSW Conference, Music and Comedy Festivals, attendees can take advantage of the opportunity to connect with a wide array of industry experts, making the Film Festival an unparalleled experience at the forefront of discovery, creativity, and innovation. Explore SXSW Film & TV Dev Patel arrives to the World Premiere of Monkey Man at SXSW 2024 - Photo by Aaron Rogosin Music Festival The SXSW Music Festival brings together artists, industry professionals, creatives, and music lovers from around the world to make connections, elevate their careers, and celebrate the magic of live music ‚Äì from legendary performers to the most exciting new talent. Explore SXSW Music Festival Bar Italia ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Oscar Moreno Comedy Festival With an established history of featuring today‚Äôs greats and tomorrow‚Äôs celebrated performers, the SXSW Comedy Festival introduces the next wave of groundbreaking comedic talent to the entertainment industry and creative community at SXSW. Learn More SXSW 2024 Attendees ‚Äì Photo by Natalie Guillot Student & Early Career Discounts Learning Goes Beyond the Classroom Currently enrolled students and recent graduates may apply for discounts to attend SXSW with an Interactive, Film & TV, or Music Badge. Complete the form to be considered for a discount based on your status. Apply Amy Webb ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Stephen Olker SXSW Timeline March 7‚Äì15, 2025 Plan your SXSW 2025 adventure today! Explore primary access per badge type across daily programming including Conference tracks, Festivals, and Exhibitions. Buy next year's badge at this year‚Äôs special low rates! We‚Äôre excited to share a reimagined SXSW experience for our 40th event. From March 6‚Äì31, 2025, lock in the lowest available rates for all badges and be first in line for hotel bookings, new info, and more. For 2026, we‚Äôre lowering presale badge prices (from 2025 rates) to help ensure that SXSW is for everyone. We‚Äôll also be streamlining access to improve the experience. Interactive, Film & TV, and Music registrants will have entry to all programming specific to their badge type, plus Keynotes, Expos, and Sales Lounges and Activations. While we‚Äôre sunsetting secondary access for Interactive, Film & TV, and Music, the lower Platinum Badge price means entry into all that SX has to offer is more affordable than ever. And act fast, because quantities for the Platinum presale are limited! With the Austin Convention Center undergoing a complete redesign until 2029, we‚Äôre taking this opportunity to reinvent spaces for our community by creating industry-specific hubs to enable new ways to connect and bring the SXSW community together, all while delivering the stellar programming we‚Äôre known for. SXSW 2026 takes place March 12-18 in Austin, TX. We hope to see you then! BUY NOW Super Sponsors Stay Tuned Sign up to receive the latest announcements, tips, networking invitations and more.

items.title: Michelle Obama and Craig Robinson Join SXSW 2025
items.description: Announcing a 2025 SXSW Featured Session with former First Lady of the United States Michelle Obama and her brother Craig Robinson on March 13.
items.content: Michelle Obama and Craig Robinson Featured Session Announced for SXSW 2025 SXSW is pleased to announce the addition of a Featured Session with former First Lady of the United States Michelle Obama and her brother Craig Robinson on Thursday, March 13 at 1pm CT. ‚ÄúMichelle Obama has long been an inspiration to us at SXSW and to millions of people around the world," said Hugh Forrest, SXSW President and Chief Programming Officer. ‚ÄúHer belief that we lift each other up by sharing our stories with one another is a core part of the SXSW experience and a key catalyst in helping creative people achieve their goals. It is the ultimate honor and an incredible thrill to welcome Michelle and her brother, Craig Robinson, to the 2025 event.‚Äù Michelle‚Äôs passion for storytelling has set sales records, garnered awards and accolades, and earned her global acclaim. Her memoir, Becoming, spent over 130 weeks on the New York Times Bestsellers list, sold more than 17 million copies worldwide, and won a Grammy Award. American Factory, the first film produced by her and her husband President Barack Obama‚Äôs media company Higher Ground, won the Academy Award for Best Documentary in 2020. Upon its release in 2020, The Michelle Obama Podcast was the most successful original in Spotify history, bringing in more women listeners over 40 than any other podcast. Through the Obama Foundation, she founded the Girls Opportunity Alliance, which supports adolescent girls' education and empowerment around the world. She is also a Co-Founder and Strategic Partner of PLEZi Nutrition, working behind-the-scenes to guide the company's mission to be a driver of change and a model for how food and beverage brands can support the health of the next generation. Craig is the Executive Director of the National Association of Basketball Coaches (NABC) and host of the Higher Ground podcast Ways To Win. From 2017-2020, he served as the vice president of Player Development and Minor League Operations for the NBA‚Äôs New York Knicks. Previously, he was a Division I head men‚Äôs basketball coach at Oregon State and Brown, and spent more than a decade working as a trader in the investment banking industry. SXSW has also recently added additional Keynote and Featured Speakers to the Conference lineup, including Tom Morello, Bryan Johnson, Lars Ulrich, Ben Stiller, Eddy Cue, Holly Herndon, Zane Lowe, Ayanna Pressley, Priscilla Chan, Shreya Murthy, Sir Tim Berners-Lee, and Robert Rodriguez. For more information, please visit the 2025 SXSW Schedule. Register today to join us at the 2025 SXSW Conference & Festivals from March 7‚Äì15 in Austin, Texas. items.title: 2025 Comedy Festival Lineup Announced
items.description: Comedy Bang! Bang!, Upright Citizens Brigade, Stand Up and Clown, Gotham Comedy Club, and much more for the 2025 SXSW Comedy Festival.
items.content: 2025 SXSW Comedy Festival Lineup Announced Announcing the full Comedy Festival lineup for SXSW 2025! From March 7-10, SXSW Comedy highlights some of today‚Äôs most compelling comedic voices, featuring standup showcases, improv, conversations, live podcast recordings, and more. Since 2008, the SXSW Comedy Festival has hosted hundreds of acclaimed comedians and performers from all corners of the entertainment industry. The festival connects today‚Äôs most influential comedy minds and the next wave of groundbreaking comedic talent with icons from the world of film and television, creating a comedy festival unlike any other. ‚ÄúSXSW hosts countless filmmakers, TV showrunners, and journalists, making SXSW Comedy rather unique among comedy festivals. It‚Äôs been a joy to watch so many comedians meet people at this festival who go on to change their lives with projects that live well beyond our stage,‚Äù said Charlie Sotelo, Head of the SXSW Comedy Festival. ‚ÄúWatching that ripple effect has been both humbling and deeply satisfying. It‚Äôs been a privilege to be a part of it.‚Äù All SXSW registrants (Platinum, Interactive, Music, and Film &TV) are welcome at all SXSW Comedy events. 2025 SXSW Comedy Festival Participants Alex English ‚Ä¢ Anthony Atamanuik ‚Ä¢ Aparna Nancherla ‚Ä¢ Bonnie McFarlane ‚Ä¢ Brian Simpson ‚Ä¢ Caitlin Peluffo ‚Ä¢ Chad Damiani ‚Ä¢ Christina Catherine Martinez ‚Ä¢ Doug Benson ‚Ä¢ Drew Dunn ‚Ä¢ Eddie Pepitone ‚Ä¢ Godfrey ‚Ä¢ Greer Barnes ‚Ä¢ Ian Lara ‚Ä¢ James Adomian ‚Ä¢ Jay Jurden ‚Ä¢ Joe DeRosa ‚Ä¢ Katherine Blanford ‚Ä¢ Kristen Toomey ‚Ä¢ Laura Peek ‚Ä¢ Lauren Lapkus ‚Ä¢ Lisa Gilroy ‚Ä¢ Lynne Koplitz ‚Ä¢ Maddie Wiener ‚Ä¢ Matt Besser ‚Ä¢ Megan Gailey ‚Ä¢ Melissa Villase√±or ‚Ä¢ Natalie Palamides ‚Ä¢ Nick Thune ‚Ä¢ Nico Carney ‚Ä¢ Opey Olagbaju ‚Ä¢ Pete Lee ‚Ä¢ Punkie Johnson ‚Ä¢ Reggie Conquest ‚Ä¢ Rich Vos ‚Ä¢ Sam Jay ‚Ä¢ Scott Aukerman ‚Ä¢ Sean Patton ‚Ä¢ Stuart Goldsmith ‚Ä¢ T.J. Miller ‚Ä¢ Todd Glass 2025 SXSW Comedy Festival Special Programs Featuring ‚Äã‚Äã 2025 SXSW Comedy Festival Special Programs Featuring: An Evening at the Hollywood Improv ‚Ä¢ Bonnie McFarlane: None of This Is Real ‚Ä¢ The Comedian‚Äôs Comedian ‚Ä¢ Comedy Bang! Bang! The Podcast ‚Ä¢ Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy All-Stars ‚Ä¢ Doug Loves Movies ‚Ä¢ ELON MUSK: DISRUPT DEMOCRACY... LOL ‚Ä¢ Elysian Nights ATX ‚Ä¢ Gotham Comedy Club Presents ‚Ä¢ improv4humans ‚Ä¢ Southwest Skankfest ‚Ä¢ Stand Up and Clown ‚Ä¢ The Stand Presents WITZ Live at SXSW ‚Ä¢ The Street Meat: A Comedic Celebration of Food Trucks, Grease Pits, and Sandwich Shops ‚Ä¢ Upright Citizens Brigade's ASSSSCAT ‚Ä¢ Would You Bang Him? Surprise guests and more! Master impressionist and comedy unicorn James Adomian kicks off the festival with his annual comedy keynote, this time in ELON MUSK: DISRUPT DEMOCRACY... LOL. Elon* and his co-conspirators seize the SXSW stage to figure out what‚Äôs wrong with everything‚Äîand fix it with chainsaw-like efficiency. *James Adomian, definitely NOT the real Elon In keeping with tradition, SXSW Comedy welcomes back festival favorites‚Äîcornerstone shows that have played a key role in shaping our annual celebration of comedy. Scott Aukerman returns with his hit improv show Comedy Bang! Bang! The Podcast with Lauren Lapkus and a surprise cast of characters. Aukerman is a defining figure in both podcasting and the ‚Äúalt-comedy‚Äù movement, fostering one of the most influential comedy scenes of our generation. Aukerman‚Äôs curatorial genius laid the foundation for what became SXSW Comedy. We‚Äôre proud to have this long-time festival pillar back on the Esther‚Äôs Follies stage for one more go-around. Known for his signature curious and insightful style, Stuart Goldsmith returns with live editions of his hit UK podcast, The Comedian‚Äôs Comedian. Goldsmith delves into the nuts and bolts of the comedic process with Scott Aukerman, Pete Lee, and Aparna Nancherla. Doug Benson is back with some friends to record Doug Loves Movies, his hit audience-interactive game show podcast, beloved by loyal comedy and film fans alike. Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre (UCB) cofounder and improv legend, Matt Besser, brings back his cult-favorite podcast and long-time festival mainstay, improv4humans. An incubator to some of the most revered television comedy talent of the past few decades, UCB continues its legacy at SXSW. Besser helms UCB‚Äôs longest-running show, ASSSSCAT, where true tales from celebrity guests inspire scenes from some of today‚Äôs most skilled improvisers including Lisa Gilroy, Anthony Atamanuik, and more. SXSW Comedy is excited to celebrate the 50th anniversary of LA's legendary Hollywood Improv. The storied club with its iconic brick wall returns with Melissa Villase√±or and other club favorites for An Evening at the Hollywood Improv. New York City institution Gotham Comedy Club upholds its legacy of showcasing the city‚Äôs funniest talent as one of the festival‚Äôs longtime collaborators with Gotham Comedy Club Presents, featuring Brian Simpson and others. Viral sensation Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy presents its first-ever roster of Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy All-Stars. Known for its secret comedy shows, popular YouTube channel, and expertly-curated lineups, Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy has become a launchpad for emerging talent. The Elysian Theater, the center of LA's burgeoning clown movement, brings its flavor of experimental, outrageous performances to this year‚Äôs comedy fest. Elysian Nights ATX is a variety show featuring Aparna Nancherla, Natalie Palamides, and other special talents who are at the heart of this cutting-edge theater. Comedy festival Skankfest and SXSW team up to bring you the festival mashup showcase, Southwest Skankfest. Skankfest has created a playground for loyal superfans and their favorite comics, inspired by the unique community built in the early days of comedy club, The Creek and The Cave. What happens when standups can‚Äôt rely on their material to win over an audience? A staple of The Elysian, Stand Up and Clown stars ruthless clown master Chad Damiani as he live-directs polished standups through their first clown show, pushing them to embrace their dumbest instincts in front of a live audience. The Street Meat: A Comedic Celebration of Food Trucks, Grease Pits, and Sandwich Shops is hosted by Joe DeRosa, comedian and proprietor of NYC sandwich shop Joey Roses. DeRosa talks about food with creators of some of the country‚Äôs greatest common cuisine‚Ä¶ and a comic or two. Acclaimed NYC comedy club, The Stand, produces a slate of live tapings at this year‚Äôs festival. Comedian and writer Bonnie McFarlane comes to SXSW for her first independently filmed standup special, None of This Is Real. McFarlane joins husband Rich Vos to host Would You Bang Him?, a comedy game show where female judges determine whether a lineup of male comedians measures up to the show's name. T.J. Miller, Sam Jay, and other club favorites take the stage for The Stand Presents WITZ Live at SXSW. Join Us Get ready for stand-up showcases, improv, conversations, live podcast recordings, and much more during the SXSW Comedy Festival. Register today to save off the March walk-up rate and experience all of the stellar programming at the 2025 SXSW Conference & Festivals. items.title: Attend | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: Experience unparalleled discovery, learning, and networking at the SXSW Conference & Festivals. Join us March 7-15, 2025 in Austin!
items.content: $2295 Walk-up Rate $2295 Primary access to ALL events Early access to 5 SXXpress passes daily Platinum Recharge Zones and badge pickup Buy Now $1695 Walk-up Rate $1695 Primary access to Conference events 4 SXXpress passes daily Mentor sessions & workshops Buy Now $1395 Walk-up Rate $1395 Primary access to Film & TV events 3 SXXpress passes daily Film & TV Festival screenings & events Buy Now $995 Walk-up Rate $995 Primary access to Music events 2 SXXpress passes daily Music Festival showcases & events Buy Now The SXSW¬Æ Conference & Festivals celebrate the convergence of the tech, film and television, and music industries. Immerse yourself in unparalleled discovery, learning, professional development, and networking alongside creatives from across the globe at SXSW 2025 from March 7-15 in Austin, TX. An essential destination for global professionals, the annual March event features Conference sessions, Film & TV Festival screenings, Music Festival showcases, Comedy Festival sets, world-class Exhibitions, competitions, Awards, and much more. Explore more information about 2025 SXSW badge rates, exclusive registrant discounts, and booking your hotel. Group Rates Bringing a team of 10 or more? Connect your team with the latest professional development tools and new collaborators amid endless networking opportunities at SXSW. Explore exclusive group rates. Learn More SXSW 2024 Attendees ‚Äì Photo by Natalie Guillot Student & Early Career Discounts Learning Goes Beyond the Classroom Currently enrolled students and recent graduates may apply for discounts to attend SXSW with an Interactive, Film & TV, or Music Badge. Complete the form to be considered for a discount based on your status. Apply Amy Webb ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Stephen Olker SXSW Timeline March 7‚Äì15, 2025 Plan your SXSW 2025 adventure today! Explore primary access per badge type across daily programming including Conference tracks, Festivals, and Exhibitions. Buy next year's badge at this year‚Äôs special low rates! We‚Äôre excited to share a reimagined SXSW experience for our 40th event. From March 6‚Äì31, 2025, lock in the lowest available rates for all badges and be first in line for hotel bookings, new info, and more. For 2026, we‚Äôre lowering presale badge prices (from 2025 rates) to help ensure that SXSW is for everyone. We‚Äôll also be streamlining access to improve the experience. Interactive, Film & TV, and Music registrants will have entry to all programming specific to their badge type, plus Keynotes, Expos, and Sales Lounges and Activations. While we‚Äôre sunsetting secondary access for Interactive, Film & TV, and Music, the lower Platinum Badge price means entry into all that SX has to offer is more affordable than ever. And act fast, because quantities for the Platinum presale are limited! With the Austin Convention Center undergoing a complete redesign until 2029, we‚Äôre taking this opportunity to reinvent spaces for our community by creating industry-specific hubs to enable new ways to connect and bring the SXSW community together, all while delivering the stellar programming we‚Äôre known for. SXSW 2026 takes place March 12-18 in Austin, TX. We hope to see you then! BUY NOW Super Sponsors Stay Tuned Sign up to receive the latest announcements, tips, networking invitations and more.

items.title: 2025 SXSW Pitch Kicks Off March 8
items.description: Get ready for the 2025 SXSW Pitch competition on March 8. Watch 45 innovative startups compete in nine exciting technology categories.
items.content: SXSW 2024 Pitch Competition Winners ‚Äì Photo by Christopher De La Rosa The 17th annual SXSW Pitch¬Æ competition kicks off tomorrow, March 8, at 10am CT in Austin, Texas! This year‚Äôs event will feature 45 of the most innovative and cutting-edge global startup companies competing in 9 categories before panels of technology experts, high-profile media personnel, and representatives from the Venture Capitalist and Angel communities. Get to know our 2025 Judges. Tomorrow‚Äôs pitches will be from 25 companies in the following categories: HealthTech, MedTech, BioTech & Accessibility; AgTech & Food; Smart Cities, Transportation & Sustainability; Security, GovTech & Space; and Student Startups. The competition continues on Sunday, March 9, starting again at 10am. The remaining 20 companies will pitch in the following categories: Robotics, Web3, Voice & Extended Reality; Entertainment, Media, Sports & Content; Enterprise, Smart Data, FinTech & Future of Work; and Innovative World Tech. For those in town, be sure to head to the Hilton Downtown (4th Floor, Salon D/E) starting at 9:30am. View the full list of 2025 finalists and alternates here. The winners of the 9 categories, along with Best in Show, Best Speed Pitch, Best Bootstrapped, and Best Inclusivity, will be announced at the SXSW Pitch Awards Ceremony at 6:30pm (6th floor, Salon H). The ceremony will be hosted by Jim Breyer, founder and chief executive officer of Breyer Capital, an investment and venture philanthropy firm, and Mary McKenna, a serial tech entrepreneur and angel investor, who is co-founder and chair of Ireland-based AwakenAngels. If you miss the pitches, you can still meet each of the 45 finalists at the SXSW Pitch ‚ÄúMeet the Startups‚Äù in the Demo Session on Monday, March 10, from 10:30am to 12:30pm at the JW Marriott Austin (2nd Floor, Griffin Hall). We hope to see you there! Join Us at SXSW Pitch SXSW Pitch is sponsored by KPMG, which goes far beyond the ordinary and the obvious to develop valuable insights that inform decisions, identify new opportunities and drive better, faster outcomes. Its diverse teams of industry professionals ask the right questions, see different perspectives, and uncover insights to bridge the gap between idea and execution. The result? Inspired innovation that works. KPMG firms operate in 143 countries and territories with more than 273,000 partners and employees working in member firms around the world. Register Your Team SXSW 2024 Attendees ‚Äì Photo by Natalie Guillot Take a break from the digital meetings and connect with your teammates in a more authentic way. Experience Conference sessions and Keynotes, Music showcases, Film screenings, world-class exhibitions, and the unexpected discoveries that are always a part of SXSW. Connect with different teams from across the globe and learn about ways they solve problems and spark creativity. Why Attend SXSW as a Group? Foster stronger team-building as you navigate the unexpected together. Empower greater exploration with built-in social support. Maximize your time with a ‚Äúdivide and conquer‚Äù approach. Strengthen collaboration and unity through a shared, unforgettable experience. Reduce professional development costs when sharing lodging, meals & transportation. Expand overall takeaways by swapping learnings, resources and tips. Bring your team of 10 or more to SXSW and save. If you haven‚Äôt decided who will be attending yet, you can still purchase registrations using placeholder names. Once your group is registered, book hotel accommodations through SXSW Housing & Travel or contact housing@sxsw.com to hold hotel rooms until names are confirmed. items.title: 2025 SXSW Film & TV Announces Closing Night and Final Slate
items.description: Announcing additional titles to the 2025 SXSW Film & TV Festival, featuring the closing night film, On Swift Horses, and more.
items.content: Announcing additional titles to round out the 32nd edition of the 2025 SXSW Film & TV Festival including Feature Films, TV projects, Short films, and XR Experiences set to debut March 7-14, 2025. Amongst the newly-announced titles, the festival's closing night film is the U.S. premiere of director Daniel Minahan‚Äôs On Swift Horses starring Daisy Edgar-Jones, Jacob Elordi, Will Poulter, Diego Calva, and Sasha Calle. "We're absolutely delighted to pull back the curtain on our full SXSW 2025 program!" said Claudette Godfrey, VP Film & TV. "From boundary-pushing independent voices to major premiere events, this year's lineup showcases storytelling at its finest. Whether you're drawn to thought-provoking documentaries, edge-of-your-seat thrillers, innovative series, immersive XR experiences, or groundbreaking international films, there's something here to inspire every audience member. The creative energy these filmmakers bring is exactly what makes SXSW such a special place for discovery and we hope you‚Äôll join our community as we gather in Austin for an unforgettable festival celebration!" The final 20 titles complete the highly-anticipated lineup that includes the opening night film, Paul Feig's Another Simple Favor, and opening night TV premiere, Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg's The Studio. Check out the final slate of titles across each screening section on the Film & TV lineup page. items.title: Attendee Guide | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: Explore SXSW resources and tools to help you navigate and access conference and festival events with the Attendee Guide.
items.content: Attendee Guide Explore SXSW resources and tools to help you navigate and access events during the SXSW Conference and Festivals each March in Austin, TX. Photo by Aaron Rogosin The Attendee Guide is your guide to SXSW with a suite of navigation tools and resources to help prepare you for the adventure ahead. Here are some things to know before you arrive: Complete Your Profile & Link Your Badge Create an account or login at id.sxsw.com to view/edit profile details, upload your badge photos, and set your status to Public to network with other attendees. Detailed instructions to link your badge can be found in our FAQs. Book Your Hotel Book a hotel through SXSW for the best rates on Austin area hotels. Download SXSW GO App Download SXSW¬Æ GO, the official SXSW mobile app. Available on iOS and Android devices. Build Your Schedule Once you have created your account on id.sxsw.com and linked your badge, build your schedule by favoriting events on the SXSW GO app or online. Stay Informed Explore the SXSW News feed and subscribe to newsletters for the latest community updates, programming announcements, and tips. Follow us across official SXSW social media channels, including Instagram, LinkedIn, Bluesky, TikTok, and YouTube. To pick up your SXSW Badge, you must present a government-issued ID. To expedite the badge pickup process, upload your photo to id.sxsw.com ahead of time. Badge and Wristband Pick-up Hours Sunday, March 2 4:00pm ‚Äì 8:00pm Monday, March 3 8:00am ‚Äì 8:00pm Tuesday, March 4 8:00am ‚Äì 6:00pm Wednesday, March 5 8:00am ‚Äì 6:00pm Thursday, March 6 8:00am ‚Äì 11:00pm Friday, March 7* 8:00am ‚Äì 11:00pm Saturday, March 8 8:00am ‚Äì 9:00pm Sunday, March 9 9:00am ‚Äì 9:00pm Monday, March 10 9:00am ‚Äì 9:00pm Tuesday, March 11 9:00am ‚Äì 9:00pm Wednesday, March 12 9:00am ‚Äì 8:00pm Thursday, March 13 9:00am ‚Äì 7:00pm Friday, March 14** 9:00am ‚Äì 7:00pm Saturday, March 15** 11:00am ‚Äì 3:00pm All times are in Central Time (CT). Dates, times, and locations subject to change. Please note the busiest registration day for SXSW is Friday, March 7. You can beat the registration lines by taking advantage of early registration for SXSW from March 2-6 or by visiting a satellite registration location *On Friday, March 14 and Saturday, March 15, badge and wristband pickup will only be available at the Austin Marriott Downtown. Registration FAQ Event Access and Line Guide See how to access different types of events and where to join the line. SXXpress Passes SXXpress passes provide front-of-line access to events. Restrictions Apply. Daily SXXpress Passes are available to all SXSW Badges ‚Äì Platinum, Interactive, Film & TV, and Music. Event Status A Green-Yellow-Red indicator allows you to check the current status for ongoing and upcoming events. Getting Around A comprehensive selection of transportation options to help you design your commute to SXSW events with ease.. SXSW Maps Looking for the best way to navigate downtown Austin? Use SXSW Maps for live shuttle tracking, event maps, and more! Accessibility Learn about accessibility information for attendees with disabilities at SXSW. Contact access@sxsw.com with any questions or requests. SXSW Tips Know Before You Go Registrants Lounge Open throughout the event, the Registrants Lounge is a convenient and relaxing meeting point for SXSW attendees. Stop by each day for one of our several SX networking events and a complimentary drink from our sponsors. Find the Registrants Lounge across from the Convention Center, where 2nd Street meets Trinity Street. Learn More Platinum Recharge Zones Platinum Recharge Zones are available for Platinum Badges to take a break, hydrate and recharge. Zones are located at the Austin Convention Center in Meeting Room 14 (3/7 - 3/13), the Hilton in Room 408 (3/7 - 3/13), and the Austin Marriott Downtown in Meeting Room 301 (3/7 - 3/15). The hours for the Platinum Recharge Zone are 9am - 5pm daily. Find Platinum Recharge Zones Family Room The Family Room is available for parents and families needing a place to care for children, change diapers, or have a quiet space with your child. Breastfeeding mothers can find privacy in a screened off area within the Family Room with fridges available. The Family Room is located in Room 405 on level four of the Austin Marriott Downtown, and is open 9:30am - 5:30pm daily from Monday, March 3 - Saturday, March 15. Sensory Rooms The sensory rooms are a calm, quiet space where attendees can take a break from the noise, lights, and crowds. They are designed to help people who might feel overwhelmed, like those with autism, sensory processing issues, or anxiety, by providing a peaceful environment and the chance to recharge during the event. View Locations SXSW Merch Truck Commemorate your trip to SXSW 2025 with some brand new gear! You can purchase the latest hats, shirts, and more at the SXSW Merch Truck. Be sure to keep an eye out for our traveling shop! Friday, March 7 - Monday, March 10SW Corner of 7th and Congress (11:00am ‚Äì 6:30pm) Tuesday, March 11 - Wednesday, March 12Rivian Demo Drives (11:00am ‚Äì 4:30pm)Red River between 8th and 9th (5:00pm ‚Äì 10:00pm) Thursday, March 13Rivian Demo Drives (11:00am ‚Äì 4:30pm)Old Red River outside Waterloo Park (5:00pm ‚Äì 10:00pm) Thursday, March 13Old Red River outside Waterloo Park (5:00pm ‚Äì 10:00pm) Friday, March 14Rivian Demo Drives (11:00am ‚Äì 4:30pm)Red River between 8th and 9th (5:00pm ‚Äì 10:00pm) Saturday, March 15Rivian Demo Drives (11:00am ‚Äì 4:30pm)Old Red River outside Waterloo Park (5:00pm ‚Äì 9:00pm) Line Guide FAQs Code of Conduct Attendee Safety Super Sponsors Stay Tuned Sign up to receive the latest announcements, tips, networking invitations and more.

items.title: SXSW GO Mobile App | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: SXSW GO is the official mobile app for getting the most out of attending SXSW. Explore app features and download for iOS and Android.
items.content: SXSW 2023 ‚Äì Photo by Tico Mendoza Official Mobile Guide Explore all of the ways to experience SXSW on the go from your device with the official SXSW GO mobile app. SXSW¬Æ GO, presented by Paramount+, is the official mobile app for the annual SXSW Conference & Festivals. With SXSW GO, you can upload your badge photo, build your schedule, and network with other attendees. Explore the SXSW Schedule featuring Conference sessions, Film & TV Festival screenings, Music Festival showcases, world-class Exhibitions, and beyond on your device. Build a customized list of must-see SX events in advance to receive recommendations and updates throughout the event. Get the most out of SXSW with our official app to amplify your IRL experience. Learn more below and check out the Attendee Services Hub for more event access and navigation information. Download SXSW GO With the SXSW GO mobile app you can browse our continuously updated lineup of programming and build your SXSW Schedule directly on your mobile device. Plus, get schedule recommendations, helpful event navigation information, and discover new music, films, and sessions. Check out mobile app Features and Pro Tips including linking your badge, checking event capacity statuses, enabling your location to get Events Nearby recommendations, and more. Download for iOS and Android. Sign in with your SXSW credentials to unlock the following features. SXSW GO Features Event Status - We‚Äôve made it easy for you to check the current status of a room or a venue‚Äôs remaining capacity for conference sessions and festival events. A Green-Yellow-Red system appears on the app, the online SXSW Schedule, and on the digital Event Status Boards located around the Austin Convention Center and other venues. Green = GO Yellow = HURRY Red = FULL Networking ‚Äì Search the directory for other SXSW attendees and send direct messages. Boost your networking with personalized recommendations from SXSW Recommends. Opt-in to location services to see who‚Äôs around you. Schedule ‚Äì Browse the entire SXSW Schedule and plan your week. Watch film trailers, listen to artist‚Äôs tracks, and learn more about conference session speakers. Star events as My Favorites and easily sync your favorites between devices. Toggle easily between the full schedule and My Schedule of your saved favorites. SXSW Recommends - The SXSW Recommends algorithm has been optimized for SXSW with machine learning! Get personalized recommendations and opt-in to notifications for real-time recommendations. SXXpress Pass - SXXpress (South by Express) Pass is a digital pass for SXSW registrants that allows front-of-line access to Music Showcases, Film & TV Screenings, Conference Sessions, and select parties. Learn more here. Venue Size - Both the app and the online SXSW Schedule will show room size information as small, medium, or large for any venue to help you plan your schedule. Events Nearby - See events currently happening close to your current location that also have available capacity. Login To start, make sure that you have logged into the SXSW GO app. If you haven‚Äôt created an account yet, you can do so by going to id.sxsw.com. This will allow you to build your SXSW Schedule and sync your Favorites between different devices. Link Your Badge To get the most out of the SXSW GO app, link your SXSW Badge. Link your SXSW Account by going to ‚ÄúMy Profile‚Äù in the SXSW GO App or by going to ‚ÄúMy Credentials on id.sxsw.com. A SXSW Link Code can also be found in your registration confirmation email or in your purchase history. When you link your credential, you‚Äôll be able to: Connect with attendees Claim SXXpress Passes RSVP for Mentor sessions and Workshops Receive personalized Recommendations Adjust your profile visibility to align with your goals Upload a photo for your badge See what events are happening nearby in March Get onsite schedule updates for your badge type in March Link your credential to your SXSW Account by going to ‚ÄúMy Profile‚Äù in the SXSW GO App or on id.sxsw.com. A SXSW Link Code can also be found in your registration confirmation email or in your purchase history. If you have any issues linking, feel free to reach out for help by emailing techsupport@sxsw.com. Finalize Your Profile If you haven‚Äôt finished setting up your profile, we recommend you take a minute to do so now by following these steps: Upload your profile photo Update Your Bio All this will help you get the most out of our networking capabilities and your own SXSW experience. Favorite and Message Attendees Don‚Äôt forget to network! You can use the SXSW GO app to search the directory for other SXSW attendees and send direct messages. You‚Äôll be able to boost your networking this SXSW season even further by receiving personalized recommendations from SXSW Recommends on the best people to connect with. You can verify if you‚Äôve opted into the Attendee List by going to the SXSW GO App > Settings > to make sure you‚Äôre opted-in to the attendee list and direct messages from other attendees.. Once you‚Äôve discovered attendees to connect with, reach out by sending a direct message. Many attendees meet their next creative collaborator, business partner, producer, investor, and more at SXSW. Set Location to "Always" Have you checked your location settings? You‚Äôll need to opt-in if you want to receive curated recommendations of events happening around you during the event. Following these directions to opt-in: Go to Settings > Privacy > Location Services (Make sure that Location Services is on) Scroll down to find the app Tap the app and select the "Always" option "Always" will allow access to your location even when the app is in the background to get the most out of your SXSW adventure. Now you're all set! Enable Bluetooth Enable Bluetooth to ensure that you are able to receive our personalized recommendations. If you‚Äôre not sure if Bluetooth is enabled, go to Settings > Privacy > Bluetooth and enable the SXSW GO app. Check Out Events Nearby Events Nearby uses your current location along with the SXSW Schedule‚Äôs current Event Status to show a real-time list of events happening near you. Don‚Äôt forget to take advantage‚Äì simply open the SXSW GO app and click on ‚ÄúEvents Nearby‚Äù in the navigation menu to get started. You‚Äôll need to opt into location services to use this feature. Opt-In For Push Notifications Opt-in to receive push messages and stay up-to-date on the latest SXSW happenings including event additions or changes. Simply go to the side menu > Profile in the app and click on the gear at the top right-hand corner. On that page, you'll see the "Opt-In for Notifications" field under "NOTIFICATIONS AND ALERTS". SXXpress Pass Sign up for your SXXpress (South by Express) Passes through the app! SXXpress Passes allow registrants with Platinum, Interactive, Film & TV, and Music Badges to request priority access to individual Conference sessions and parties, Music Festival Showcases, Film & TV Festival Screenings, and Comedy Festival Showcases. SXXpress Pass signup opens at 9am on the day before an event (two days before the event for Platinum badges). Best of all, they are digital and can be requested directly through the SXSW GO app as well as the SXSW Schedule. Before you can sign up for SXXpress Passes, you must log in and link your badge in SXSW GO or at id.sxsw.com, using the SXSW Link Code found in your registration confirmation email or in your purchase history. RSVP for Mentor Sessions Our Mentor Sessions offer one-on-one coaching by professionals from all areas of the tech, film, and music industries. Within the 75 minute duration of Mentor Sessions, there will be five one-on-one meetings lasting 15 minutes each. Mentor Sessions require advance sign-up and access is limited to the badge types listed on the Mentor‚Äôs schedule information. Register for SXSW 2025 Experience unparalleled discovery at SXSW 2025 from March 7-15 in Austin, TX. Secure your SXSW Badge today! Learn More News Browse the latest announcements, programming features, and important dates. Read On Conference Festivals Exhibitions Attend SXSW Super Sponsors Stay Tuned Sign up to receive the latest announcements, tips, networking invitations and more.

items.title: SXXpress Pass | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: SXXpress Passes allow SXSW registrants to request priority access to Conference Sessions, Music Festival Showcases, Film & TV Festival Screenings, and more.
items.content: SXXpress Passes Get the best access to your most anticipated SXSW events with SXXpress (South by Express) Passes! SXSW 2024 Attendees ‚Äì Photo by Tico Mendoza The digital SXXpress (South by Express) Passes are a resource for SXSW registrants to not only secure a spot at must-see events but also jump to the front of the line. Daily SXXpress Passes are available to all SXSW Badges ‚Äì Platinum, Interactive, Film & TV, and Music. Registrants may request priority access for themselves to individual Conference Sessions, Screenings, Music Festival Showcases, and Comedy Festival Showcases. SXXpress passes are based on a small portion of the event room size and are available for our in-person event only. Don‚Äôt fret! If you are not able to secure a SXXpress Pass for a certain event, you can still attend by checking Event Status on the Schedule or the SXSW GO mobile app to plan accordingly and by waiting in your designated badge line. SXXpress Passes are digital and can be requested through the SXSW Schedule or in SXSW GO, the official mobile app. Before you can reserve SXXpress Passes, you must log in and link your badge in SXSW GO or SXSW ID, using the SXSW Link Code found in your registration confirmation email. Starting from 9:00am CT on the day before the event (two days before the event for Platinum badges), log in to SXSW GO or the SXSW Schedule, navigate to the event, and click the "Request SXXpress Pass" button. You are only able to request a SXXpress pass to an event that you have primary access to. If you are reserving a pass for an eligible event, you will see a ‚ÄúConfirm SXXpress Pass‚Äù button and a confirmation email will be sent if the pass is granted. Screenings and Sessions: the request period will end when the limited number of Passes have been claimed or 5 hours before the session, whichever comes first. Music Showcases: the request period will end when the limited number of Passes have been claimed or at 3pm the day of the showcase, whichever comes first. You will be sent an email for each successful SXXpress Pass request, including instructions on using the digital pass and when to arrive at the event. Note: If you receive an error message when requesting a SXXpress Pass, then your request was not successfully processed. A successful SXXpress Pass request will result in a confirmation email notification. You cannot claim SXXpress passes over your daily limit or more than once for the same event You can request a SXXpress Pass for events that you have primary access to based on your badge type. The allotment of SXXpress Passes per badge type and the events you can request them for is as follows: Platinum: registrants may request up to five passes per day at 9:00am CT two days in advance for primary access to all Conference Sessions, Film & TV Screenings, Music Festival Showcases, and Comedy Festival Showcases. Interactive: registrants may request up to four passes per day for primary access to all Conference Sessions and Comedy Festival Showcases. Film & TV: registrants may request up to three passes per day for primary access to Film & TV Screenings, Film & TV Conference Tracks plus sessions with primary access for all badges, and Comedy Festival Showcases. Music: registrants may request up to two passes per day for primary access to Music Showcases, Music Conference Tracks plus sessions with primary access for all badges, and Comedy Festival Showcases. Event types that do not have SXXpress Passes include: Networking Meet Ups, Mentor Sessions, Workshops, and Roundtables. If you are 1) already signed up for the event, 2) have already reached daily allowance of passes, or 3) do not have primary access with your badge type, select a different event to request a SXXpress Pass. Your SXSW Badge is required for entry. For Conference Sessions, go to the designated SXXpress area at the front of the primary access line, no later than 15 minutes before the session starts. For Film & TV Screenings, go to the designated area at the front of the primary access line at the theatre, no later than 30 minutes before the listed time for the screening. For Music and Comedy Showcases, go to the front of the primary access line at the host venue. Need Help? If you are having an issue requesting a SXXpress Pass, please stop by any of our Information Booths. You may also email us at info@sxsw.com. If your plans have changed and you no longer need your SXXPress Pass, we‚Äôve got you covered! You can return your pass to make it available for another attendee. Returning an unused pass also allows you the opportunity to claim a pass for another event. Simply visit My SXXPress Passes on the Schedule or in the GO app to return your pass. Click the red ‚ÄúReturn SXXpress Pass‚Äù button to return. The return period for Screenings and Sessions will end 5 hours before the session and the return period for Music Showcases will end at 3pm the day of the showcase. You will be sent an email for each return. Please note: All returns are final ‚Äì THIS ACTION IS FINAL AND CANNOT BE UNDONE. Once you return your pass, it cannot be reclaimed, reissued, or reinstated. Notes: SXSW Film & TV Screenings: 1) A SXXpress Pass provides admittance only to the event specified (venue and date) on the Pass; 2) The name on your badge and SXXpress Pass must be identical; 3) SXXpress Passes are non-transferable and are only valid when accompanied with your valid SXSW Badge; 4) You must arrive no later than 30 minutes before the start of the film and proceed to the designated area at the front of the Primary Access badge line; 5) Admission subject to capacity restrictions; 6) The period to request a Pass ends when the quantity of Passes allocated have been claimed; 7) All returns are final ‚Äì THIS ACTION IS FINAL AND CANNOT BE UNDONE. 8) If you receive an error message when requesting a SXXpress Pass, then your request was not successfully processed. A successful SXXpress Pass request will result in a confirmation email notification.* SXSW Music Showcases: 1) A SXXpress Pass provides admittance only to the event specified (venue and date) on the Pass; 2) The name on your badge and SXXpress Pass must be identical; 3) SXXpress Passes are non-transferable and are only valid when accompanied with your valid SXSW Badge; 4) SXXpress Passes do not guarantee admission, which is subject to venue capacity; 5) Due to strict alcohol beverage laws in Texas, all venues require a government-issued photo ID for entry; 6) SXXpress Passes are not valid for minors at venues that do not admit minors; 7) The period to request a Pass ends when the quantity of Passes allocated have been claimed; 8) SXXpress Passes may not be available for some showcases; 9) All returns are final ‚Äì THIS ACTION IS FINAL AND CANNOT BE UNDONE; 10) If you receive an error message when requesting a SXXpress Pass, then your request was not successfully processed. A successful SXXpress Pass request will result in a confirmation email notification.* SXSW Conference: 1) A SXXpress Pass provides admittance only to the event specified (venue and date) on the Pass; 2) The name on your badge and SXXpress Pass must be identical; 3) SXXpress Passes are non-transferable and are only valid when accompanied with your valid SXSW Badge; 4) Admission is subject to capacity restrictions; 5) No reserved seating; 6) The period to request a Pass ends when the quantity of Passes allocated have been claimed; 7) All returns are final ‚Äì THIS ACTION IS FINAL AND CANNOT BE UNDONE; 8) If you receive an error message when requesting a SXXpress Pass, then your request was not successfully processed. A successful SXXpress Pass request will result in a confirmation email notification.* Super Sponsors Stay Tuned Sign up to receive the latest announcements, tips, networking invitations and more.

items.title: Line Guide | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: Get ready for SXSW with our Line Guide: everything you need to know about badge access, SXXpress passes, and event policies.
items.content: SXSW Line Guide Ready to take on SXSW? Whether you're a first timer or a SXSW veteran, here's a rundown of event access by badge type and more. There are four SXSW Badge types: Platinum, Interactive, Film & TV, and Music. Badges are tied to two access types: Primary: admitted first Secondary: admitted second, after primary line The Platinum Badge offers primary access to all SXSW events, including but not limited to: Conference Sessions, Music Showcases, Film & TV screenings, Comedy Showcases, and networking opportunities. The Interactive Badge gives you access to professional development and learning opportunities with primary entry to all Conference events including sessions, mentors, and workshops. The Interactive Badge also grants you secondary access to a majority of Film & TV screenings and Music showcases, subject to venue capacity. The Film & TV Badge is your pass to nine days of screenings, including world premieres, featuring a high caliber and diverse lineup of Film, TV, and XR during the Film & TV Festival. During the Conference, these badgeholders have primary access to Film & TV sessions, including mentor sessions and workshops. Plus, secondary access to a majority of Interactive and Music programming and Music Festival showcases. The Music Badge is your primary entry key to our legendary Music Festival showcases as well as music programming, mentor sessions, and workshops at the Conference. Plus, secondary access to most Interactive and Film & TV programming, and Film & TV Festival screenings. All badgeholders have primary access to daily Conference Keynotes, Featured sessions, Comedy Festival showcases, Exhibitions, and the Registrants Lounge. Throughout SXSW, you‚Äôll find icons matching your badge type to help you navigate through the event. SXXpress Passes A portion of each event‚Äôs capacity is allocated for the SXXpress pass pool, granting front-of-line access to events. Badgeholders can reserve SXXpress Passes that correspond to their badge type in the SXSW GO mobile app and on the SXSW Schedule starting at 9am CST, two days before each event for Platinum badgeholders, and at 9am CST the day before each event for Interactive, Film & TV, and Music badgeholders. Restrictions apply. See SXXpress Pass for details. Event Status allows you to check the current status for ongoing and upcoming events. A Green-Yellow-Red indicator appears on the SXSW GO app, the online SXSW Schedule, and on the digital Event Status Boards located around the Austin Convention Center and other venues. Primary Access Platinum and Interactive badge holders gain primary access to all Conference programming. If you have a Film & TV or Music Badge, you have primary entry to the respective Conference tracks and events that match your badge type. All badgeholders have equal access to daily Keynotes, featured sessions, and 8 designated conference tracks (see Conference Track Timeline). This programming does not have secondary access. Secondary Access For Interactive tracks, if space remains after Platinum and Interactive badgeholders are seated, Film & TV and Music badgeholders will be admitted next. For Music tracks, if space remains after Platinum, Interactive and Music badgeholders are seated, Film & TV badgeholders will be admitted next. For Film & TV tracks, if space remains after Platinum, Interactive and Film & TV badgeholders are seated, Music badgeholders will be admitted next. Encore Sessions Each year at the SXSW Conference, the multitude of topics bring a high demand for sessions across multiple tracks of programming. While Conference sessions can quickly fill up, Encore Sessions provide additional opportunities to experience this season‚Äôs most compelling content. Check the SXSW Schedule for Encore Sessions announced daily during the March event. Lining Up for Film & TV Festival Screenings You should arrive 1 hour before screening time. When you arrive, look for the line that corresponds to your badge type. Primary Access Queue Cards are distributed to Platinum and Film & TV badgeholders starting one hour before screening time, and will be handed out until capacity has been met. This ensures your admission as long as you stay at the venue and are in line when seating begins. Buffer Cards will be handed out to remaining badgeholders after all available Queue Cards are distributed. While these cards do not guarantee entry to the venue, they will help Film & TV and Platinum badgeholders to secure a seat if any become available. Secondary Access If seats still remain after Platinum and Film & TV badgeholders are admitted, Film & TV Wristbands, Music Badges, and Interactive Badges may access a screening via the Secondary Access Line. Public Pre-Sale Tickets A limited number of Public Pre-Sale Tickets will be available for select screenings. You can find SXSW Film & TV Festival screenings with Public Pre-Sale Tickets available for purchase here. Please note, if you are a Central Texas resident, planning to attend five or more screenings, consider purchasing a Film & TV Wristband. Eligible zip codes are verified at checkout. Public Day-of Tickets On the day of a screening, if seats still remain after Primary and Secondary Access are admitted, day-of tickets will be sold starting at $30 (plus venue fees) 15 minutes before showtime at the venue box office. Film & TV Festival Venues The SXSW Film & TV Festival take place at various Official Venues across Austin. Learn more information about each venue location, transportation options and more. Film & TV Venues Film & TV Festival Status Board Check the Film & TV Festival Status Board or see the event status in the SXSW GO app before you go. Remember that event status will be available starting on the first day of events. Film & TV Festival Status Board Primary Access Music and Platinum badgeholders get primary access to Music Festival showcases. Secondary Access If space remains after Platinum & Music badgeholders are admitted, Interactive Badges, Film & TV Badges, and Music Wristbands may access a showcase via the Secondary Access Line. General Admission Tickets After both primary and secondary lines have entered, general admittance tickets may be available to the public at official SXSW Music Festival venues, subject to venue capacity. Access information is posted at the door of each venue. Bag Policies Before you leave, make sure to check venue bag policies to ensure you can access the venue. items.title: Keynotes | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: At the crux of each day's SXSW Conference programming, join us for hour-long Keynotes by some of the creative and tech industry's most inspired thinkers.
items.content: Keynotes At the center of the SXSW Conference, Keynotes drive the shared daily dialogue that connects the many industry professionals in attendance from around the globe. 2025 Conference Lineup Dr. Joy Buolamwini Keynote ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Michael Buckner These sessions run for one hour each, showcasing some of the world's most inspired thinkers as they tackle the most timely topics of today and tomorrow. All SXSW Badges have equal access to all Keynote sessions. See You at SXSW 2025 Join us for SXSW 2025 from March 7‚Äì15 in Austin, TX. Register and book your hotel today! Stay tuned for announcements throughout the season by subscribing to Event Updates and community newsletters. Ita√∫ is the official 2025 SXSW Streaming Sponsor for Conference Keynotes and Featured Sessions, offering digital translation services in Spanish & Portuguese. Bryan Johnson Bryan Johnson is an entrepreneur and visionary. Join us for what is sure to be a moving conversation exploring the vastness of consciousness and the future of humanity. View Session Issa Rae Join actor, writer, and producer Issa Rae as she delves into her latest work as an executive producer. Seen and Heard is a two-part documentary that travels through time, creating a kaleidoscopic portrait of Black talent being ‚Äúseen‚Äù and Black creatives being ‚Äúheard,‚Äù shaping today‚Äôs Golden Age of Black television. View Session Meredith Whittaker Think about it: everyone has something to hide these days even--maybe, especially--if you're the good guy. Join this tactical, practical, and heretical discussion between Meredith Whittaker, President of Signal and leading advocate for secure communication, and Guy Kawasaki, host of the Remarkable People podcast. View Session Ben Lamm and Joe Manganiello In this fireside chat, Ben Lamm and Joe Manganiello showcase groundbreaking technologies like gene editing, cloning, and artificial wombs that are restoring extinct species. But this isn‚Äôt just about de-extinction‚Äîit‚Äôs about creating new technologies to also save existing species. View Session Jay Graber, CEO of Bluesky Social Jay Graber is the CEO of Bluesky, a public benefit company building an open and decentralized standard for social media. Previously, she built Happening, a site for social events, and developed Zcash, a privacy-preserving cryptocurrency. She has also worked as an organizer at digital rights nonprofits. View Session John Fogerty John Fogerty is a Grammy winner and has been inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame as well as the Songwriters Hall of Fame. He is the only musician to be inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame for his song, ‚ÄúCenterfield,‚Äù a staple at baseball stadiums across the country. Among Fogerty‚Äôs many hit songs, which have sold over 100 million records, both as a solo artist and as leader of CCR, highlights include ‚ÄúProud Mary,‚Äù ‚ÄúSusie Q,‚Äù ‚ÄúFortunate Son,‚Äù ‚ÄúBorn on the Bayou,‚Äù ‚ÄúBad Moon Rising,‚Äù and ‚ÄúHave You Ever Seen the Rain,‚Äù among many others. View Session Arvind Krishna, CEO of IBM When it comes to AI and quantum computing, it‚Äôs time to move past the sci-fi hype and start building real-world applications that expand what is possible with technology. We have entered a new era in which computers can learn, generate and operate independently, and at the same time, an entirely new computing paradigm is rapidly evolving that leverages quantum mechanics to solve seemingly impossible challenges. Join IBM Chairman & CEO Arvind Krishna for a discussion on how business and society can benefit from the convergence of these next frontiers in technology. View Session Breaking Barriers, Shaping Narratives: How Women Lead On and Off the Screen 2024 Keynote Tracy Chou & Deonne Castaneda 2024 Keynote Speakers Dr. Joy Buolamwini 2024 Keynote Speaker Sue Bird & Jessica Robertson 2024 Keynote Speakers Dan Auerbach & Patrick Carney 2024 Keynote Speaker Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert 2024 Keynote ‚ÄúWhy did we write Everything, Everywhere All At Once the way we did? The answer is we did it to save ourselves. Every story and every art we make is an act of saving ourselves and our value from a system that wants to devalue us and the people we care about.‚Äù Lisa Su2024 Keynote ‚ÄúIf you can learn how to solve problems, you're going to do great things.‚Äù Jack Conte2024 Keynote ‚ÄúIt's so important to remember to make beautiful things. To make things that light you up and to make things that you care about." Tilda Swinton2023 Keynote ‚ÄúKeep your dreams soft and malleable, flexible, and porous-and fun!‚Äù Priyanka Chopra Jonas 2023 Keynote "Any woman that takes a step forward, turn around and pull someone else up with you. " Watch Now Willie Nelson 2021 Keynote "It's important to have those valuable things to keep you going." Watch Now Olivia Wilde 2019 Film Keynote "I realized if I wanted things to change, if I wanted to make my voice heard, I was going to have to shift the paradigm from within." Watch Now Ta-Nehisi Coates 2018 Keynote "Ask me about something I haven‚Äôt read on or reported on, I‚Äôm not gonna say much about it. When you go into a punch your feet have got to be set." Watch Now Barack Obama 2016 Keynote "It‚Äôs not enough to focus on the cool, next big thing. It‚Äôs harnessing the cool, next big thing to help people in this country." Watch Now Jessica Shortall 2017 Keynote "Love past your comfort zone." items.title: Getting Around Austin | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: SXSW works with a variety of transportation services to provide a comprehensive list of options to help you navigate events around Austin with ease.
items.content: Getting Around A comprehensive selection of transportation options to help you design your commute to SXSW events. Use the guide below to find the services that work best for your budget and needs. SXSW 2023 ‚Äî Photo by Aaron Rogosin We highly recommend considering all other options before deciding to drive. With many street closures downtown, as well as heightened vehicle, scooter and foot traffic, driving can be an expensive and time-consuming endeavor as downtown parking ranges in both price and availability. Digital Floorplans and Maps Navigating SXSW is easier than ever via SXSW Maps. See where venues are located in proximity to each other, navigate multi-level venues, and get point-to-point navigation so you can get exactly where you need to go. SXSW Maps A free circulating shuttle route runs between the Austin Convention Center and most SXSW venues, for SXSW registrants. Catch the SXSW Shuttle outside the Convention Center on Trinity Street. Visit maps.sxsw.com to see where the shuttles are in real time. SXSW Shuttle Tracker Fetii ‚Äì The Official Group Rideshare of SXSW Need a ride for your group? Fetii makes it easy to travel together with on-demand 15-passenger vans, perfect for getting to and from SXSW events. Simply download the Fetii app, request or preschedule a ride, and enjoy seamless group transportation. üöê Get 25% Off Your First 3 Rides ‚Äì Use promo code SXSW25 at checkout. üì≤ Download the Fetii App and ride together! Airport Transportation Carter Transportation Austin is the preferred airport transportation service for SXSW. They offer a stellar shared-ride service with convenience, price transparency, and affordability for rides to and from the airport and around town. Rental Cars Enterprise is the car rental company of choice for SXSW. Hauling gear? Taking a road trip to Lockhart for BBQ? Whatever your rental car needs, Enterprise will take care of you. CapMetro Public Transportation CapMetro is Austin‚Äôs regional public transportation provider. They provide residents, commuters, and visitors the best possible transit options available. More Information ¬ª With the CapMetro App, your smartphone becomes your ticket. Use the app for schedules, maps, and real-time arrival information. Download the app ¬ª MetroBike When you‚Äôre ready to give your feet a break, check out MetroBike, Austin‚Äôs bike-share system. Bike-share stations are conveniently placed throughout downtown near all the places you want to be. Austin MetroBike is another fast, easy way to get around during SXSW, day or night. Day access passes are available at each B-station; all you need is a credit card! Bikes adjust to fit individual sizes and come equipped with baskets, lights, and gears. More Information ¬ª Pedicabs Pedicabs operate throughout Austin day and night, mostly in the Central Business District, Rainey St, and East 6th St areas. Pedicab drivers are licensed and regulated by the City of Austin Ground Transportation Department and usually work for tips or a charge-per-block fare. Look for pedicab staging areas around downtown, or just flag one down. Electric Cab Electric Cab provides a fun, safe, and green ride for evening entertainment and special event pedestrians in Downtown Austin. More Information & Service Area ¬ª Traditional Taxi Services Cabs are in high demand during SXSW. Schedule a Taxi or call to arrange for pick-up from your hotel. The following cab services operate in the Austin area: zTrip Austin ‚Äì (512) 452-9999 or book through the zTrip App ATX Co-op Taxi ‚Äì (512) 333-5555 Parking Area parking ranges in price and availability. Arriving into the downtown area early is the best bet for securing parking. Parking locations and availability can be found on the City of Austin‚Äôs website. The Austin Convention Center has two parking garages, located at 2nd & Brazos and 5th & Red River. See their website for more information and pricing details. While driving is always an option, we don‚Äôt encourage using a car, as you will experience high traffic volume and high parking fees in and around Downtown Austin. The City of Austin closes various streets in downtown Austin during Spring Festival Season, which includes SXSW. For more information regarding the City of Austin‚Äôs street closures, click here. Note: Austin is a major city so expect delays during peak traffic hours on weekday mornings (7am-9am) and evenings (4:30pm-7pm). Be sure to schedule extra time for transportation when traveling during these hours. Austin Chronicle's Transportation Guide How to get around Austin, with or without your own wheels. items.title: Formats | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: From Featured Speakers to Workshops, learn more about the session formats for programming at the SXSW Conference.
items.content: Formats The SXSW Conference provides a variety of programming formats aimed at empowering attendees to explore, discover, and build relationships. Maximize your experience by identifying which of these formats align best with your creative and career aspirations. RSVPs Are Now Open Featured Session: A Conversation with "Civil War" Filmmaker Alex Garland and Cast ‚Äì Photo by Andy Wenstrand The SXSW Conference provides a variety of programming formats aimed at empowering attendees to explore, discover, and build relationships. Maximize your experience by identifying which of these formats align best with your creative and career aspirations. See You at SXSW 2025 Join us for SXSW 2025 from March 7‚Äì15 in Austin, TX. Registration and housing are now open! Explore participation opportunities and stay tuned for announcements throughout the season. Subscribe to Event Updates and community newsletters. Questions about SXSW sessions? Email us at sessions@sxsw.com. Get Email Updates 1 Hour Sessions Keynotes Powerful Presentations by Diverse Visionaries Daily Keynotes showcase some of the world's most inspired thinkers with powerful new ideas in the ever-evolving worlds of technology, film, culture, and music. Keynote: Breaking Barriers, Shaping Narratives: How Women Lead On and Off the Screen ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Virginia Hernandez 1 Hour Sessions Featured Sessions Mind-expanding Conversations Featured Sessions bring together some of the biggest and brightest names of our time. Spanning across various trends and SXSW Conference tracks, Featured Speakers present a snapshot of the most transformative ideas shaping our future. Jane Fonda and David Fenton ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by River Callaway 1 Hour Sessions Presentations / Panels Gain Industry Expertise Presentations include 1-2 experts offering deep dives into targeted topics. Panels feature 3-4 industry professionals sharing different perspectives based on a specific subject. Fireside Chats include 2 speakers in conversation discussing a variety of topics. SXSW 2024 Featured Session: Moviegoing Lift: Loyalty, Subscription & MoviePass ‚Äì Photo by Lauren Hatfield 90-120 Minute Sessions Workshops Up Your Career Development Game Workshops offer a variety of hands-on learning activities and specific takeaways for professional growth. RSVP Neuroplasticity Laughter Workshop ‚Äì SXSW 2023 ‚Äì Photo by Judy Won 15 Minute Sessions Mentor Sessions Connect with Industry Experts Mentor Sessions offer one-on-one coaching by professionals from all areas of the tech, film, and music industries. Within the 75 minute duration of Mentor Sessions, there will be five one-on-one meetings. items.title: Transportation Track | SXSW Conference
items.description: New technology continues to transform the ecosystems of planes, trains and automobiles. This track content is geared toward understanding the best new ideas on how to move people and products from here to there.
items.content: Driven by Rivian Transportation Track March 11-13, 2025 New technology continues to transform the transportation ecosystem, driving a new era of connected, sustainable mobility, and enhanced passenger experience. Autonomous vehicles are making significant progress, with ride-hailing services, and delivery applications increasingly deployed in cities around the world. As EV sales are surging in Europe and parts of Asia, the U.S. market continues to face challenges in the form of fluctuating demand, charging infrastructure, and supply-chain headaches. Meanwhile, climate-conscious solutions for the aviation industry are gaining traction and attention at a rapid pace. items.description: The SXSW Film and TV Festival celebrates raw innovation and emerging talent both behind and in front of the camera.
items.content: The Fall Guy World Premiere ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Miguel Esparza Film & TV Festival March 7-15, 2025 The SXSW Film & TV Festival festival is known for launching a high caliber and diverse program of film, TV and XR projects, and serving as a global gathering for smart, enthusiastic, influential audiences that drive conversation for months to come. 2025 Film & TV Lineup Creatives of all stripes gather for the acclaimed SXSW Film & TV Festival program each March in Austin, Texas. Running concurrently with the SXSW Conference, Music, and Comedy Festivals, attendees can take advantage of the opportunity to connect with a wide array of industry experts, making the Film & TV Festival an unparalleled experience at the forefront of all things pop culture. Whether you want to be the first to see independent films from around the world or sit front row at the world premiere of a buzzy Hollywood project, SXSW serves as the place to be for discovery, creativity, and innovation. See You at SXSW 2025 Join us for SXSW 2025 from March 7‚Äì15 in Austin, TX. Register and book your hotel today! Stay tuned for announcements throughout the season by subscribing to Event Updates and community newsletters. 2025 SXSW Film & TV Lineup The highly-anticipated 32nd edition lineup of the SXSW Film & TV Festival is here! Be there for the festival‚Äôs Opening Night TV Premiere of the eagerly anticipated Apple TV+ The Studio and many more exciting titles. View The Lineup SXSW Timeline March 7-15, 2025 Plan your SXSW 2025 adventure today!
