Feature Film Section Narrative Feature Competition: World premieres showcasing the art of storytelling by emerging voices. Documentary Feature Competition: World premieres of captivating, real stories by emerging voices. Headliner: Big names, big talent featuring red carpet premieres and gala film events with major and rising names in cinema. Narrative Spotlight: Unforgettable features receiving their World, North American, or U.S. premieres. Documentary Spotlight: Incredible features receiving their World, North American, or U.S. premieres. Visions: Audacious, risk-taking films that demonstrate innovation and creativity. Midnighter: Exciting after-dark features for genre lovers and the terminally curious. 24 Beats Per Second: Vibrant films showcasing the sounds, culture and influence of music and musicians. Global: Artful international films, featuring premieres, festival favorites, and more. Festival Favorite: Acclaimed standouts from festivals around the world. Special Event: Unexpected and unique one-off film and TV events. TV Screening Sections TV Premiere: World premieres of prestige TV series premieres from acclaimed showrunners and directors. Independent TV Pilot Competition: Discover new pilots from indie talent. TV Spotlight: World premieres of new seasons of acclaimed shows and exciting series episodes. Short Film Screening Sections Narrative Short Competition: Exceptional storytelling that captivates, surprises, and excites. Documentary Short Competition: Authentic storytelling that captivates, surprises, and excites. Animated Short Competition: A whirlwind tour of hand drawn, stop-motion, and digital revelries. Midnight Short Competition: Indulge your cravings for horror, gore, and dark comedy. Music Video Competition: A dynamic mix of creativity and stylish visuals where music and storytelling collide. Texas Short Competition: Vibrant work filmed in, inspired by, or connected to the Lone Star State. XR Experience Screening Sections XR Experience Competition: World premieres of mind bending immersive art. XR Experience Spotlight: Masterful immersive art from around the world. XR Experience Special Event: Radical experimentations with emerging tech. 2025 SXSW Film & TV Festival Lineup The highly-anticipated 32nd edition of the SXSW Film & TV Festival lineup is here! items.title: SXSW Community Service Awards | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: The SXSW Community Service Awards honors individuals and organizations for their dedication to fostering positive community impact.
items.content: SXSW Community Service Awards The SXSW Community Service Awards honor individuals and organizations for their dedication to fostering positive community impact. Each honoree receives a grant, complimentary entry to SXSW, and recognition at an awards ceremony during the SXSW event. SXSW 2024 Community Service Honoree ‚Äì Photo by Anthony Moreno The SXSW Community Service Awards celebrate leaders and non-profit organizations from Austin and around the world who work tirelessly to improve the standing of the specific groups and causes that they serve. This program was launched to honor the memory of SXSW Interactive co-founder Dewey Winburne and remains true to the vision that grassroots community activism is the most essential building block for progressive change on a much larger societal level. Explore past honorees: 2024 | 2023 | 2022 | 2021 | 2020 | 2019 | 2018 | 2017 Sav Rodgers Transgender Film Center | Service to Film & TV Originally from Kansas, Sav Rodgers is a filmmaker, writer, and pop culture documentarian. Sav‚Äôs debut feature Chasing Chasing Amy explores the complicated legacy of Chasing Amy (1997) and its profound impression on his life. In 2018, Sav gave a TED Talk on the subject, appropriately titled, ‚ÄúThe rom-com that saved my life.‚Äù The film had its World Premiere at Tribeca, and played at prestigious festivals including the BFI London Film Festival, Outfest Los Angeles, and the Palm Springs International Festival. Sav was awarded the Cleveland International Film Festival‚Äôs DReam Maker Award for pioneering LGBTQ+ filmmakers for his work on the documentary. Sav‚Äôs experiences as a queer Midwesterner with a wild imagination have spurred the writing of scripts that center on highly specific, surprising stories about LGTBQ+ people. His screenplays have been recognized by GLAAD, Outfest, ScreenCraft, among others. Named to Forbes 30 Under 30 in 2024, Sav is also the Founder and Executive Director of the Transgender Film Center, a nonprofit aiming to help trans creators bring finished films to audiences around the world. In 2024, TFC awarded $100K in funding to transgender filmmakers. In 2025, they are on track to grant $170K. Learn More Michael Gonzalez Rural Schools Innovation Zone / Service to Education Mike Gonzalez, an unwavering advocate for equitable education, serves as the Executive Director of the Rural Schools Innovation Zone (RSIZ). With over 30 years of experience in the education field, Mike has demonstrated an enduring commitment to fostering opportunities for students in South Texas while building the Zone, a catalyst for rural innovation across the country. Mike's educational journey began as a teacher and coach, a role he held for two years, where he not only imparted knowledge but also served as a mentor and role model to young minds. His passion for guiding students led him to take on the responsibilities of an athletic director for seven years. Recognizing the pivotal role that school leadership plays in shaping educational outcomes, Michael stepped into the role of principal for a remarkable 17 years. During this time, he tirelessly worked to create nurturing environments that empowered students to excel academically and personally. His dedication to the betterment of rural education in South Texas began to crystallize during these years. In his current position as the Executive Director of RSIZ for the past five years, Micha Gonzalez has become a driving force in the fight for opportunities in rural communities. firmly believes that a student's potential should never be limited by their zip code. Mike tireless efforts and visionary leadership have paved the way for innovative solutions that bridge the gap between urban and rural education, offering all students an equal chance to pursue their dreams. Mike's exceptional contributions to education have not gone unnoticed. He has received numerous awards and recognitions throughout his career, both at a personal level and on behalf of RSIZ, showcasing his dedication and impact on the education community. Outside of his professional life, Michael is a devoted husband of 31 years to his wife Judi and a proud father to three children: Danielle Barnes (30), Kristen Gonzalez (27), and Jordan Gonzalez (22). These personal connections fuel his commitment to creating a brighter future for all students in South Texas. Mike's story is one of unwavering dedication, visionary leadership, and a profound belief in the transformative power of education. His journey continues to inspire those who are fortunate enough to work alongside him as he leads RSIZ towards a future where every rural student has the opportunity to achieve their dreams. Learn More Nicole Klepladlo The Red River Cultural District | Service to Music Nicole Klepadlo is an accomplished leader with over 15 years of experience driving mission-driven community initiatives and policies that strengthen and sustain the creative industries and place-based efforts. With a background in social work and community and economic development planning, she brings a deep understanding of how people, place, and cultural experiences intersect to shape vibrant communities. As the Founder of Roots + Connections Consulting Nicole has been a champion for music, arts and local economies, leveraging strategic planning, advocacy, and capacity-building to empower creatives and cultural organizations. With a love for place-based initiatives, her work focuses on fostering consensus and driving tangible change at the intersection of policy, commerce, and creativity. In her role as the Executive Director for the Red River Cultural District, Nicole employs a creative, community-driven approach to protect and nurture a vital arts and culture district facing development pressures and shifting urban dynamics. Through collaboration with local, state, and federal stakeholders‚Äîas well as grassroots organizing‚Äîshe has helped shape a model for sustaining cultural districts amid rapid change and evolution. She also works closely with a coalition of music-based nonprofits to safeguard and grow the creative economy, ensuring artist and cultural workers have the resources and support they need to thrive. A native of Michigan, Nicole holds a Master‚Äôs in Urban Planning from Wayne State University in Detroit and has earned certifications in nonprofit management and economic development finance from the National Development Council. Her multifaceted expertise‚Äîspanning community planning, economic development, entrepreneurship, and the creative industries‚Äîpositions her as a dynamic force in fostering inclusive growth and amplifying underrepresented voices and causes. Throughout her career, Nicole has led cross-functional teams and developed impactful programs and policies that drive meaningful support for artists, musicians, cultural and local entrepreneurs. With experience in the nonprofit, philanthropic community finance, music, creative, startup, private, and government sectors, she thrives in hands-on projects and is deeply committed to mentorship and long-term sustainability for the creative economy. Learn More Matthew Long [C]worthy.org | Service to Environmental Conservation Matthew Long, PhD, is co-founder and CEO of [C]Worthy, a non-profit research organization focused on building tools to ensure safe, effective ocean-based carbon dioxide removal (CDR). Prior to co-founding [C]Worthy, Long held a position as a Scientist at the National Center for Atmospheric Research, where he worked on the development of the Community Earth System Model and conducted research on ocean biogeochemistry, marine ecosystems, and the global carbon cycle. Prior to NCAR, he built and deployed instruments to measure ocean carbon variables at sea, worked as a civil engineer developing river and sewer-network models, and taught high school as a United States Peace Corps volunteer in Tanzania. Dr. Long holds Master's and Bachelor's degrees in Civil and Environmental Engineering from Tufts University and a Ph.D. in Oceanography from Stanford University. Learn More Anne Filipic No Kid Hungry | Service to Ending Hunger Over the past twenty years, Anne Filipic has led consequential civic, philanthropic, and political efforts that have helped transform the nation. Currently, Anne is CEO of Share Our Strength, a national non-profit helping kids, families and communities through the No Kid Hungry campaign, and working on the root causes of hunger to create more financial security for families. Previously, she served in the White House as Assistant to the President for Management and Administration. In this role, Anne was responsible for building and maintaining the most diverse staff in White House history. Prior to joining the White House, Anne was the Chief Program Officer at the Obama Foundation, where she developed global programs focused on civic engagement and leadership development. She also oversaw the integration of two major initiatives, My Brother‚Äôs Keeper and The Girls Opportunity Alliance, into the Obama Foundation. Previously, Anne led Enroll America, a national healthcare coalition designed to support Americans in enrolling in and retaining healthcare coverage made available through the Affordable Care Act. Enroll America‚Äôs work supported a net increase of over 20 million Americans gaining healthcare coverage in under four years. In recognition of Enroll America‚Äôs impact, Anne was named one of the ‚ÄúTop 100 Most Influential People in Healthcare‚Äù by Modern Healthcare magazine. Anne has also served as Deputy Director of the White House Office of Public Engagement and Deputy Director of Intergovernmental Affairs at the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. She started her career in electoral campaigns and advocacy, including holding leadership roles on President Obama‚Äôs 2008 campaign and serving as Field Director for the Obama Iowa caucus campaign. Originally from Ohio, Anne is a graduate of Washington University in St. Louis. She lives in Washington, DC with her husband, Carlos, and their three young children. Awards are granted to participants from Film & TV Festival, Music Festival, SXSW Pitch, and Innovation Awards. items.title: SXSW Film & TV Awards | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: The SXSW Film & TV Festival Awards honor the superlative creativity and talent demonstrated in the SXSW program each March.
items.content: Film & TV Awards The Film & TV Awards honor the superlative creativity demonstrated by the film, TV, XR, and design talent in the SXSW Film & TV Festival program. Stay tuned for the 2025 winners to be announced on Wednesday, March 12. Narrative Feature Jury Award Winner: Bob Trevino Likes It - Photo by Edward Bennett The 2025 SXSW Film & TV Festival Narrative Feature Competition, Documentary Feature Competition, Design Awards, and Special Awards winners will be announced during the Film & TV Awards Ceremony on Wednesday, March 12, along with all the Short Film Program winners, which are eligible for Jury Awards within their respective screening categories. Awards Screening Categories Narrative Feature Competition: World premieres showcasing the art of storytelling by emerging voices. Documentary Feature Competition: World premieres of captivating, real stories by emerging voices. Narrative Short Competition: Exceptional storytelling that captivates, surprises, and excites. Documentary Short Competition: Authentic storytelling that captivates, surprises, and excites. Midnight Short Competition: Indulge your cravings for horror, gore, and dark comedy. Animated Short Competition: A whirlwind tour of hand drawn, stop-motion, and digital revelries. Music Video Competition: A range of classic, innovative, and stylish work showcasing the scope of music video culture. Texas Short Competition: Vibrant work filmed in, inspired by, or connected to the Lone Star State. Independent TV Pilot Competition: Discover new pilots from indie talent. Poster Design Competition: Uniquely illustrated prints designed to reflect the themes, tone, and characters of a festival selection. XR Experience Competition: World premieres of mind bending immersive art. In addition to the Jury Awards, all Film and TV projects are eligible for Audience Awards in their various sections, with voting certified by Maxwell Locke & Ritter. SXSW is proud to be an official qualifying festival for the Academy Awards¬Æ Short Film competition. Winners of our Best Animated, Best Narrative and Best Documentary Short Film categories become eligible for Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences awards (Oscars). Any British Short Film or British Short Animation that screens at SXSW is eligible for BAFTA nomination. Films are also eligible for the Independent Spirit Awards. The Film & TV Awards honor the superlative creativity demonstrated by the film, TV, XR, and design talent in the SXSW Film & TV Festival program. Stay tuned for the 2025 winners to be announced on March 12 during the Film & TV Awards Ceremony. items.title: Innovation Awards | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: The annual SXSW Innovation Awards celebrate and honor the most exciting tech developments in the connected world.
items.content: presented by LATAM Airlines Innovation Awards Explore this year‚Äôs most transformative and forward-thinking projects and products at the Finalist Showcase, then celebrate the winners at the Innovation Awards Ceremony at South By Southwest¬Æ. Adrian Grenier at the SXSW Innovation Awards ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Anthony Moreno The SXSW Innovation Awards recognize the most exciting creative developments in the connected world, celebrating a variety of technological advancements, achievements, and discoveries. Five finalists in each category will be chosen to exhibit their projects at the seventh annual Innovation Awards Finalist Showcase during SXSW 2025, where the Finalist Judges will determine the winners as well as Best of Show. SXSW audiences attending the Finalist Showcase will also vote to determine the winner of the People‚Äôs Choice award. Participation in the Finalist Showcase is required for consideration in all award categories. Winners will be announced and presented their awards at the 26th annual SXSW Innovation Awards Ceremony on the evening of Monday, March 10 at the Austin Convention Center (Ballroom D) from 6-8pm CT. See You at SXSW 2025 Join us for SXSW 2025 from March 7‚Äì15 in Austin, TX. Register and book your hotel. Explore the latest news and stay tuned for announcements throughout the season. items.title: SXSW Exhibitions | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: SXSW plays host to many distinctly different exhibitions that connect people from all over the world. Explore SXSW Exhibitions.
items.content: Exhibitions Immerse yourself in a dynamic fusion of creativity and cutting-edge concepts that push the boundaries of what's possible. SXSW exhibitions are where industry innovation comes to life, where new ideas are born, and where the future is on display. Discover interactive installations, leading-edge technology demos, art exhibits, performance showcases and more.Exhibit at SXSW Innovation Award Winner at the SXSW Expo ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Aaron Rogosin Not Your Average Exhibition Leave behind the hum-drum days of aimlessly wandering down aisles of pamphlets and giveaway mints. SXSW Exhibitions create a unique space to discover while cultivating opportunities for collaboration. From robots to holograms, no idea is too far-fetched. SXSW Expo The SXSW Expo is the convergence of all industries on the cutting-edge of technology, design, social good, health + wellness, and more. SXSW spends the year searching for brands, services and products that will take attendees into the 22nd century and beyond. Hundreds of exhibitors from across the globe meet under one roof to ignite passions, collaborate and share groundbreaking discoveries. Learn More 2024 SXSW Expo Aerial Shot ‚Äì Photo by David Brendan Hall Flatstock Flatstock is an art exhibition of the world‚Äôs most influential gig poster artists, featuring handmade, limited-edition posters and merchandise from artists around the globe. The show features an incredible range of visual styles, techniques and colors for sale by the talented artists who created them. Learn More FlatStock ‚Äì Photo by Tico Mendoza XR Experience Immerse yourself in the latest VR/AR and mixed reality storytelling from some of the most creative minds in the world at the SXSW XR Experience. items.title: SXSW Hall of Fame | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: The SXSW Hall of Fame honors exceptional trailblazers whose work shaped the connected world.
items.content: SXSW Hall of Fame Honoring those exceptional trailblazers whose work has helped shape the connected world and who continue to guide digital industries. The SXSW Hall of Fame recognizes those trendsetters whose career accomplishments have paved the future in a variety of industries. These honorees inspire the SXSW community with their creativity and hard work in the digital industries. We are pleased to announce our 2025 SXSW Hall of Fame Inductee, Mark Cuban. Past SXSW Hall of Fame inductees include Margrethe Vestager (2024), Dan Rather (2023), Nonny de la PenÃÉa (2022), Kimberly Bryant (2019), Eli Pariser (2018), Kara Swisher (2017), Baratunde Thurston (2016), Tamara Hudgins, PHD (2015), Joi Ito (2014), danah boyd (2013) and Jeffrey Zeldman (2012). Learn more about this year's inductee and past recipients below. Mark Cuban (2025) Mark Cuban is an investor who lives for his family, his Shark Tank companies and the Dallas Mavericks. He is the co-owner of the 2011 World Champion Dallas Mavericks and bestselling author of ‚ÄúHow to Win at the Sport of Business,‚Äù and was an entrepreneur from age 12 when he sold garbage bags door to door. Today, Cuban is the highly successful entrepreneur and investor with an ever-growing portfolio of businesses. A lifelong entrepreneur and investor, Cuban has started and built multiple industry-changing organizations including Costplusdrugs.com, which sells medications at industry low pricing with total cost transparency, which he founded with Dr. Alex Oshmansky. Named a winner of the GQ Men of the Year in 2006 and included in The New York Times Magazine‚Äôs Year in Ideas, Cuban is recognized as being among the most influential people in both the cable and sports industries. He may be best known for his purchase of the Dallas Mavericks on Jan. 4, 2000. Under his leadership, the team‚Äôs home games have become a total entertainment experience. Prior to his purchase of the Mavericks, Cuban co-founded the first commercial streaming company AudioNet, which became Broadcast.com, the leading provider of multimedia and streaming on the Internet. Broadcast.com was sold to Yahoo! Inc. in July 2000. MicroSolutions, a leading national systems integrator, was co-founded by Cuban and partner Martin Woodall in 1983, and later sold to CompuServe. Margrethe Vestager (2024) Margrethe Vestager serves as the Executive Vice President of the European Commission. She is in charge of enforcing the European Union‚Äôs rules designed to keep the markets fair. Vestager also sets the strategic direction of a Europe Fit for the Digital Age, aimed to make sure that the digital technology supports our society‚Äôs goals and is behind the EU's recent artificial intelligence strategy. She steered the work on upgrading liability and safety rules for digital platforms with the new Digital Services Act and the work on designing regulation to maintain gatekeeper platforms contestable with the new Digital Markets Act. Dan Rather (2023) With a famed and storied career, Dan Rather is one of the world‚Äôs best-known journalists. He has covered almost every important dateline over the last 70 years, is a member of the Television Hall of Fame, and has won the biggest awards in electronic journalism, many numerous times He's also interviewed every president since Eisenhower. Rather joined CBS News in 1962. He quickly rose through the ranks, and in 1981 he assumed the position of anchor and managing editor of the CBS Evening News ‚Äî a post he held for 24 years. His reporting across the network helped turn 60 Minutes into an institution, launched 48 Hours as an innovative news magazine program, and shaped countless specials and documentaries. Upon leaving CBS, Rather returned to the in-depth reporting he always loved, creating the Emmy Award winning news and documentary program, Dan Rather Reports. Rather has written several best selling books and continues to shape the public discourse through his media appearances, extensive reach on social media, and his Steady newsletter. Rather has been a very active voice in the SXSW community. In addition to serving as a keynote speaker in 2008, he interviewed Parkland shooting survivor David Hogg in 2019. Post pandemic, he has been part of several sessions at SXSW EDU that focus on the Rather Prize, which annually donates $10,000 to the person with the best idea in Texas education. Nonny de la PenÃÉa (2022) Nonny de la Pe√±a, Ph.D. is the founder of Emblematic Group where she uses cutting-edge technologies to tell stories ‚Äî both fictional and news-based ‚Äî that create intense, empathic engagement. She recently joined Arizona State University (ASU) as the founding director of the new Narrative and Emerging Media center located in downtown Los Angeles where she leads a best-in-class research and graduate program with a focus on new narratives developed using emerging media technologies including virtual, mixed and augmented reality, virtual production and spatial content in the areas of arts, culture and nonfiction. A Yale Poynter Media Fellow and a former correspondent for Newsweek, de la Pe√±a is widely credited with pioneering the genre of immersive journalism. She is a WSJ Technology Innovator of the Year, one of CNET‚Äôs 20 Most Influential Latinos in Tech, a Wired Magazine #MakeTechHuman Agent of Change and Fast Company named her ‚ÄúOne of the People Who Made the World More Creative.‚Äù As a journalist and filmmaker, de la Pe√±a has more than 20 years of award-winning experience, writing for publications such as Time Magazine, New York and LA Times, and working in feature documentary and film production. Her paper in the MIT journal Presence, ‚ÄúImmersive Journalism: Immersive Virtual Reality for the First-Person Experience of the News,‚Äù is the second most downloaded article in the journal‚Äôs history, and her TED talk, which describes the use of cutting-edge technologies for putting viewers on scene at real news events, has garnered more than 1,300,000 views. Nonny was previously a Convergence Keynote at the 2018 SXSW Conference. With her dedication to advancing the way we use technology to tell stories and poised successes throughout her career, her induction to the SXSW Hall of Fame is one that is unparalleled for 2022. Kimberly Bryant (2019) Kimberly Bryant is the Founder and CEO of Black Girls CODE, a non-profit organization dedicated to ‚Äúchanging the face of technology‚Äù by introducing girls of color (ages 7-17) to the field of technology and computer science with a concentration on entrepreneurial concepts. Prior to starting Black Girls CODE, Kimberly enjoyed a successful 20+ year professional career in the pharmaceutical and biotech industries as an Engineering Manager in a series of technical leadership roles for various Fortune 50 companies such as Genentech, Merck, and Pfizer. Since 2011 Kimberly has helped Black Girls CODE grow from a local grassroots initiative serving only the Bay Area, to an international organization with fourteen chapters across the U.S. and in Johannesburg, South Africa. Black Girls CODE has currently reached over 7000 students and continues to grow and thrive. Kimberly has been nationally recognized as a thought leader for her work to increase opportunities for women and girls in the technology industry and has received numerous awards for her work with Black Girls CODE. Kimberly has been awarded the prestigious Jefferson Award for Community Service for her work to support communities in the Bay Area, named by Business Insider on its list of ‚ÄúThe 25 Most Influential African-Americans in Technology‚Äù, and named to The Root 100 and the Ebony Power 100 lists in 2013. Kimberly was named a White House as a Champion of Change for her work in tech inclusion and for her focus on bridging the digital divide for girls of color and received an Ingenuity Award in Social Progress from the Smithsonian Institute. She has been identified as a thought leader in the area of tech inclusion and has spoken on the topic at conferences nationally and internationally such as the Personal Democracy Forum, TedX Kansas City, Platform Summit, Big Ideas Festival, SXSW, and many others. Eli Pariser (2018) Eli Pariser is the President of Upworthy and GOOD Worldwide. He has dedicated his career to figuring out how technology can elevate important topics in the world ‚Äî as an author, an online organizer, and most recently, as a co-founder of Upworthy. Pariser served as the executive director of MoveOn.org from 2004-2009, growing membership to more than 5 million members and raising over $120 million. Pariser also co-founded Avaaz.org, which is now the largest online advocacy organization in the world. In 2011, Pariser published the bestselling book The Filter Bubble: What the Internet Is Hiding from You. Pariser founded Upworthy with longtime collaborator Peter Koechley in March 2012. The pair set out to prove once and for all that what‚Äôs important can be incredibly popular, even if what‚Äôs popular isn‚Äôt usually important. Kara Swisher (2017) Kara Swisher is the executive editor and co-founder of Recode, host of the Recode Decode podcast, and co-executive producer of the Code Conference series. Since Web 2.0, Swisher has long been out in front of the cutting edge consistently sussing out important digital industry trends. Swisher breaks the most salient news with a sharp lens that focuses on the heart of a story with immediacy, unparalleled insight, and her uncanny ability to find the truth. Swisher also co-founded Revere Digital, an independent media company that housed Recode and Code, with Walt Mossberg. It was acquired in 2015 by Vox Media. Recodes‚Äôs flagship conference, Code, has hosted interviewees such as Bill Gates and Steve Jobs as well as most of the leading players in the tech and media industries. It is considered one of the leading conferences focused on the convergence of tech and media industries. Before Recode, Swisher and Mossberg created and ran the All Things Digital website and the D conference for The Wall Street Journal. Swisher also covered breaking news about the Web‚Äôs major players and Internet policy issues, and also wrote feature articles on technology for The Wall Street Journal‚Äôs San Francisco bureau. She has also written a weekly column for the Personal Journal on home issues called ‚ÄúHome Economics,‚Äù worked as a reporter at the Washington Post, and as an editor at the Washington City Paper. In addition to her many accomplishments, Swisher is the author of aol.com: How Steve Case Beat Bill Gates, Nailed the Netheads and Made Millions in the War for the Web (Times Business Books; 1998), and the sequel, There Must Be a Pony in Here Somewhere: The AOL Time Warner Debacle and the Quest for a Digital Future (Crown Business Books; 2003). Swisher has been a long-time friend of SXSW, and a frequent guest as a speaker, interviewer, and moderator. She has lent her wit and clarity to panels such as ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs a C-Word! Lessons From Tech‚Äôs C-Suite Women‚Äù (2015), ‚ÄúWhy Didn‚Äôt a Tech Journalist Break PRISM?‚Äù (2014), ‚ÄúA Home on the Web: The State of Blogging‚Äù (2013), and ‚ÄúAnything You Can Do, I Can Do Backwards in Heels‚Äù (2012), among many others. Baratunde Thurston (2016) Baratunde Thurston is a supervising producer at The Daily Show with Trevor Noah on Comedy Central where he oversees digital expansion. A New York Times bestselling author, activist, comedian, and entrepreneur, Thurston has an uncanny ability to crack the shell of any uncomfortable topic through a personal, accessible, and intelligent point of view. His work has found expression in the pages of Fast Company, on the screens of HBO, Comedy Central, CNN, MSNBC, BBC, on NPR and countless podcasts, including Our National Conversation About Conversations About Race. He has hosted shows on Discovery's Science Channel, Yahoo, AOL, YouTube, and Pivot TV, where he was co-host of TakePart Live. He is a co-founder of Jack & Jill Politics, has served as Digital Director of The Onion, a Judge for the Knight Foundation News Challenge, an affiliate at the Berkman Center for Internet and Society, and as a director‚Äôs fellow at the MIT Media Lab. He authored the New York Times bestseller How To Be Black, and is a co-founder of Cultivated Wit which produces Comedy Hack Day. Baratunde has been honored by the ACLU of Michigan ‚Äúfor changing the political and social landscape one laugh at a time,‚Äù nominated for the Bill Hicks Award for Thought Provoking Comedy, and has been named on The Root‚Äôs list of the 100 most influential African Americans, as well as Fast Company‚Äôs 100 Most Creative People In Business. He has advised the Obama White House and serves on the National Board of BUILD. Indeed, Baratunde has been a beloved part of SXSW Interactive for many years, from hosting Fray Cafe in 2008, to hosting the Interactive Web Awards in 2009, to a perennial favorite speaker from 2010 - 2014, including the Keynote ‚ÄúHow to Read the World‚Äù in 2012. Come celebrate Baratunde Thurston‚Äôs induction into the SXSW Hall of Fame with us at the Innovation Awards ceremony, Tuesday, March 15, 2016 in the 6th floor ballroom of the Hilton Austin Downtown. Tamara Hudgins, PHD (2015) Tamara Hudgins serves as the Executive Director of Girlstart whose mission is to increase girls‚Äô interest and engagement in STEM through innovative, nationally-recognized informal STEM education programs such as Girlstart After School programs and Summer Camp. Founded in Austin, Texas, Girlstart is the only community-based informal STEM education nonprofit in the nation that is specifically dedicated to empowering and equipping girls in STEM through year-round STEM educational programming. Since Hudgins joined in 2009, Girlstart‚Äôs impact has grown from reaching 1,500 girls, teachers, and family members each year to over 15,000. Additionally, the Girlstart After School has grown from 4 to 45 programs, has been recognized as the most robust program of its kind in the nation, and is now replicating regionally. Girlstart Summer Camp, the second core program, has expanded from 8 to 22 week-long programs each summer, with replication outside Austin as well as in six states nationwide. Both Girlstart After School and Girlstart Summer Camp have been recognized by Change the Equation in the STEMWorks database, with Girlstart Summer Camp further recognized as one of four ‚Äúexemplary‚Äù and ‚Äúhighly scalable‚Äù STEM education programs in America. Joi Ito (2014) Currently serving as Director of the MIT Media Lab in Cambridge, Joi Ito posses a new media career that spans an impressive variety of sectors. He is a Board Member of The Sony Corporation, The New York Times Company, The MacArthur Foundation, The Knight Foundation, Creative Commons and co-founder and board member of Digital Garage an Internet company in Japan. He is on board of a number of non-profit organizations including The Mozilla Foundation and WITNESS. Ito has created numerous Internet companies including PSINet Japan, Digital Garage and Infoseek Japan and was an early stage investor in Twitter, Six Apart, Wikia, Flickr, Last.fm, Kickstarter, Path and other Internet companies. He is the Guild Custodian of the World of Warcraft guild, We Know. He is a PADI IDC Staff Instructor, an Emergency First Responder Instructor and a Divers Alert Network (DAN) Instructor Trainer. Ito was named by Businessweek as one of the 25 Most Influential People on the Web in 2008. In 2011, he was chosen by Foreign Poicy Magazine as one of the "Top 100 Global Thinkers." In 2011, he received the Lifetime Achievement Award from the Oxford Internet Institute in recognition of his role as one of the world's leading advocates of Internet freedom. In 2011 and 2012, Ito was chosen by Nikkei Business as one of the 100 most influential people for the future of Japan. Ito received the degree of Doctor of Literature, honoris causa, from The New School in 2013. danah boyd (2013) For 2013, we welcomed danah boyd as the second member of the SXSW Hall of Fame. boyd is a Senior Researcher at Microsoft Research, a Research Assistant Professor in Media, Culture, and Communication at New York University, a Fellow at Harvard's Berkman Center for Internet and Society, a Research Fellow of the Born This Way Foundation, and an Adjunct Associate Professor at the University of New South Wales. Her research examines the intersection of technology, society, and youth culture. Currently, she's focused on privacy, youth practices and cruelty, and human trafficking. She co-authored Hanging Out, Messing Around, and Geeking Out: Kids Living and Learning with New Media. boyd is currently working on a new book titled, It's Complicated: The Social Lives of Networked Teens. Jeffrey Zeldman (2012) Web design pioneer Jeffrey Zeldman became the first ever inductee to the SXSW Hall of Fame at the 15th Annual SXSW Interactive Awards Ceremony on Tuesday, March 13, 2012. Dubbed the King of Web Standards by Business Week, Zeldman publishes A List Apart ‚Äúfor people who make websites,‚Äù a leading journal of web design thought since 1998. He is also the founder and executive creative director of Happy Cog‚Ñ¢, a design agency with studios in New York, Philadelphia, and San Francisco. He has written two books, notably the foundational web standards text, Designing With Web Standards 3rd Edition, with Ethan Marcotte. items.title: SXSW Pitch | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: SXSW Pitch showcases innovative new technology to a panel of industry experts, high-profile media professionals, and venture capital and angel investors.
items.content: <iframe src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-WB7Z9Q5" height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe> presented by KPMG SXSW Pitch March 8-10, 2025 SXSW Pitch showcases innovative new technology to a panel of industry experts, high-profile media professionals, venture capital investors, and angel investors. 2025 Pitch Schedule SXSW 2024 Pitch Ceremony ‚Äì Photo by Christopher De La Rosa SXSW Pitch, presented by KPMG, returns for its 17th year to showcase some of the global startup ecosystem's most exciting, innovative, and cutting-edge technology from March 8-10, 2025 in Austin, TX during SXSW 2025. Explore nine competition categories and the 2025 Finalists and Alternates set to take the pitch stage this March. According to Pitchbook, finalists involved in the SXSW Pitch competition have raised more than $23.2 billion in funding since 2009. This competition provides an outlet for early stage startup companies to present their emerging innovative technology across nine categories to a panel of industry technology experts, high-profile media personnel, and venture capitalists/angel investors. Pitch Sessions March 8-9, Downtown Austin Hilton Hotel - Salon DE- 4th Floor Pitch Sessions Schedule Pitch Award Ceremony March 9, Hilton Hotel- Salon H 6:30-8:00PM Pitch Award Ceremony For SXSW Pitch inquiries, please contact michelle@sxsw.com and send press inquiries to conferencepress@sxsw.com. Co-Emcees Jim Breyer - Founder & CEO Breyer Capital Jim is the Founder and CEO of Breyer Capital, a premier venture capital firm headquartered in Austin, Texas since 2020. Jim has been an early investor in over 40 technology companies that have completed highly successful public offerings or mergers. As a lead investor and Director, many of these investments, including Facebook, returned well over 100 times their cost, and over a dozen more have returned well over 25 times their cost. Over the past several years, Jim has developed a deep personal and investment interest in long-term oriented entrepreneurs and teams working in artificial/augmented intelligence (AI), quantum technology, and computation-driven healthcare and life sciences. Mary McKenna Mary McKenna is an Irish exited serial tech entrepreneur and angel investor. She co-founded successful ed-tech business Learning Pool and since selling that company, has worked extensively with early stage and scaling ventures across the entire European ecosystem. Mary has angel invested in 35+ early stage tech startups to date and in 2023 launched Ireland‚Äôs first and only women-led angel syndicate, AwakenAngels. Mary is a distinguished visiting Entrepreneur in Residence at the University of Oxford and she was both the European Female Business Angel of the Year and the UK Business Angels Association UK Angel of the Year in 2023. Mary works as an Innovation Expert for the EU on their flagship ‚Ç¨9bn EIC Accelerator, part of Horizon Europe. AgTech & Food Technologies within agriculture, horticulture and aquaculture that improve yield, increase efficiency and/or reduce environmental impact. Examples include food sustainability, farm data, soil microbe data, crop protection, biofertilizers, supply chain transparency, agri-food testing, alternative proteins, animal health, aquaculture, farm management software, hydroponics, vertical farming, Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), and precision agriculture. Enterprise, Smart Data, FinTech & Future of Work sponsored by Notion Technologies that increase productivity for businesses and/or individuals by simplifying informational data through automation and/or new workflows and analytics. These startups may have applications in the future of work, data collection, management, organization, big data simulation, analysis, data visualization and presentation, interpretation, privacy and security, predictive analytics, payments, cryptocurrencies, money sharing platforms, fraud protection, open banking, Machine Learning Operations, cognitive computing, APIs, personalization, supply chain, business communications, project management, payments, human resources, cloud computing, and augmentation across industries such as business, finance, advertising, and more. Entertainment, Media, Sports & Content Technologies and applications that are re-inventing the experience of leisure, information, sports, and entertainment. Industries these technologies service may include gaming, music, film, television, video, arts, news and publishing, e-sports, sports analytics, streaming, podcasting and audio content, social media, user-generated content platforms, digital storytelling, and more. Robotics, Web3, Voice & Extended Reality Technologies that enhance the way people connect, communicate, and share unique life experiences with those around them in a digital ecosystem. These technologies may be related to machine-simulated intelligence, consciousness, ease, speech, the Internet of Things and smart devices, or a machine's ability to perform, anticipate, and streamline tasks without human assistance. These startups seek to address a wide variety of issues and may include Web 3.0 applications, wearables, blockchain technology, multi-sensory incorporation, augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), Super Apps, generative AI, AI chips, autonomous systems, human-robot interaction, Robotic Process Automation, Natural Language Processing, and more. HealthTech, MedTech, BioTech & Accessibility Technologies focused on human-centric applications that advance medicine and wellness and connect individuals with health systems and facilities, medical technologies and devices, care teams, providers, insurance, corporate and personal wellness services, and public health and social services. These startups may include applications in aging and geriatrics, vaccines, mRNA technology, general wellness, assistive technology, diagnosis, treatment, fertility, genetics, sports and exercise, home fitness, cannabis, sleep, and medical wearable technologies. Innovative World Tech sponsored by Amplitude This category is for any creative and innovative application, product, or service that does not fit in another SXSW Pitch category, as well as technologies that act as the infrastructure that new technologies are built on. Examples that might fit into this category include (but are not limited to) societal good, social networking, supply chain, payment and fintech, biotechnology and nanotechnology, pet tech, drones, home refinancing, quantum computing and computer chip technology, and others. Security, GovTech & Space Technology in this category improves the ability of first responders & other public safety personnel to serve their communities. This category leverages technology from six major areas: artificial intelligence/machine learning, autonomy, cyber, energy, human systems, and space. Autonomous systems can be further subcategorized into awareness & security, unmanned aerial systems, and maritime autonomy. Space can be further subcategorized into launch services, domain & situational awareness, transport & navigation, satellites & connectivity, manufacturing and hypersonic. Smart Cities, Transportation & Sustainability Technologies that create and advance smart cities and/or enhance sustainable practices by providing services and products for local environments, which includes buildings, neighborhoods, communities, and public spaces. These innovations may find applications in sustainability, climate change, renewable power sources, real estate development, transportation, tourism, logistics, product delivery, autonomous vehicles, ridesharing, infrastructure, utilities, public works, security, population data, government and civic services, urban planning and design, waste management and recycling, water management and conservation, green building, air quality monitoring and pollution control, disaster resilience and emergency management, and more. Student Startups sponsored by The University of Texas at Austin Student startups that are showcasing innovative technology with a focus on Agtech & Food; Security, GovTech & Space; Enterprise, Smart Data, FinTech, & Future of Work; Entertainment, Media, Sports, & Content; Robotics, Web3, Voice & Extended Reality; Healthcare, MedTech, AssistiveTech & BioTech; Innovative World Tech; Smart Cities, Transportation, & Sustainability. Announcing 70+ finalists and alternates across nine competition categories for the 2025 SXSW Pitch event in Austin, TX from March 8‚Äì10. AgTech & Food Finalists Azul Brooklyn, NY Azul Bio is focused on preserving coral reefs using Coral Microbiome Boosters (CMBs) to mitigate environmental risks affecting the real estate and tourism industries. CMBs are isolated beneficial bacteria that enhance coral resilience to heat-induced bleaching by triggering physiological adaptations in coral hosts, thereby expanding the temperature range at which corals can survive. Earnest Agriculture Rantoul, IL Earnest Agriculture develops probiotic seed coatings using a proprietary microbe-matching platform to improve soil health, boost crop yields, and enhance resilience. Backed by proven results and industry partnerships, we deliver sustainable solutions that help farmers reduce inputs and increase productivity. Entomal Biotech Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia Entomal Biotech pioneers scalable solutions using Black Soldier Fly bioconversion to transform food waste into valuable resources, addressing global issues of waste, emissions, and food security sustainably. Farmish Grand Rapids, MI Farmish is a marketplace platform that connects local farms with consumers and wholesale buyers across the U.S. and Canada. We democratize access to new markets and business opportunities, empowering farmers to build sustainable income streams, strengthen local food systems, and foster resilience and connection within their communities. Knead Technologies Calgary, Canada Knead Technologies is a B2B software company that enables scalable food recovery solutions in real-time to meet the $940 billion global food waste challenge. Alternates Agrinerds Davis, CA Waterfowl like ducks and geese are the primary reservoir of Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI). The WaterFowl Alert Network (WFAN) forecasts where waterfowl and HPAI are in order to protect the nation‚Äôs 44,000+ commercial poultry farms, 20,000+ dairies and 60,000+ swine premises. Capture Tech Ann Arbor, MI Capture Tech uses system-based approaches in order to prevent ecological damage from environmental contamination sources while bio-transforming those contaminants into resources for environmental restoration. XLSOR Fort Collins, CO XLSOR‚Äôs innovative technology leverages a decade of research and Machine Learning to solve the $420m+ fruit loss problem impacting growers and retailers today. Our ML models transform a few minutes of pre-harvest, non-destructive fruit scans, orchard data, and climate data into precise timing and quality predictions in real time to eliminate the surprises of climate shifts. Enterprise, Smart Data, FinTech & Future of Work Finalists Fazeshift San Francisco, CA AI Agent for Accounts Receivable. Launch Ahead AI Tulsa, OK Launch Ahead, founded by visionary entrepreneur and advocate Amnoni Myers, who brings lived experience in foster care, empowers youth with tools to thrive as they transition into adulthood. Through personalized pathways, mentorship, and data-driven agency solutions, Launch Ahead transforms the foster care journey, creating opportunities and brighter futures nationwide. Polygraf AI Austin, TX Polygraf.ai offers an agentic AI DLP infrastructure for secure data transactions, enabling organizations to adopt AI tools without risking exposure and maintaining content provenance. The solution uses advanced Small Language Model Agents to prevent AI-generated impersonation and fraud, secure sensitive data by employing smart anonymization, and enhance AI transparency with flexible deployment options. Safebooks AI San Francisco, CA Safebooks is the world's first financial data governance platform designed to help finance teams validate and substantiate the integrity, completeness, and accuracy of all transactions, across all systems, in real time. We help finance teams save money, conduct faster audits, and manage all financial data with 100% precision. Springboards Sydney, Australia Springboards is a creative tool to inspire‚Äînot give you the answer. Built for advertising and marketing pros, it‚Äôs a suite of generative AI tools designed around a traditional agency workflow to keep humans in the creative equation. Alternates MasRefund Raleigh, NC MasRefund takes the fear and complexity out of filing taxes by making it as easy as uno, dos, tres! A bilingual tax filing app in English and Spanish. It‚Äôs affordable and simple; perfect for tech-savvy Millennials and Gen Zs. MasRefund tax filing - a time saving hack. Trez Houston, TX Trez is the first U.S. Latino-focused financial tech stack empowering Latino SMBs with culturally relevant payroll and financial solutions. By leveraging AI-powered, voice-command payroll through WhatsApp, used by 90% of minority entrepreneurs in the U.S. Trez brings ultra-speed service to this underserved market, saving time and enhancing trust. Serving a $180 billion Hispanic fintech market, Trez is purpose-built to streamline financial operations for Latino business owners. Viva Benefits Austin, TX Viva empowers housing partners to offer life-changing benefits to renters - like access to doctors, tutors for kids, cash back to save, and grants to help buy homes - so we can close the 40X wealth equity gap between renters and homeowners. All U.S. residents can access a FREE version at VivaBenefits.com. Entertainment, Media, Sports & Content Finalists HAND (Human & Digital) Brooklyn, NY HAND (Human & Digital) is a business intelligence platform with an interoperable, ISO-level standard registry at its core. Like an "IP address for talent," HAND applies Citation-Backed Notability‚Ñ¢ to assign resolvable "forever IDs" to quantifiably notable talent across cultural industries of Sports, Entertainment, Music, Art, Fashion, Gaming, News, and more. Human Native AI London, England Human Native AI is an AI data platform that fairly benefits both rights holders and AI developers. We equip AI developers with the high quality, wide-ranging data needed to build powerful AI models, while ensuring rights holders are fairly paid for use of their work. NeuralGarage Bangalore, India NeuralGarage is a Generative AI startup creating proprietary technology in the audio-visual domain for the Entertainment, Media and Content Industries. Our proprietary technology, VisualDub, addresses the issue of "Visual Dissonance" in dubbed content by syncing the lips and jaws of actors with that of the dubbed audio to create a seamless viewing experience for the audience. Vobble Bengaluru, India Vobble is revolutionizing kids' audio entertainment with an AI-powered pocket player. It offers immersive podcasts, music, interactive games, and a unique AI-driven audio story creation tool. Kids listen, learn, and create, sparking imagination in a generation lost to screens. Zibra AI Kyiv, Ukraine Zibra AI is a Ukrainian deep tech company that builds AI-powered solutions for VFX and 3D creation for gaming, TV, filming, and more. Alternates EVEN Brooklyn, NY EVEN empowers creators‚Äîfrom emerging artists to global superstars‚Äîto sell music, merchandise, and experiences directly to superfans before a wide release. With innovative tools and global reach, EVEN helps artists generate real revenue, own their data, and foster deeper fan connections, redefining how creators share and monetize their work. Showcase Scranton, PA Showcase is a fan-first platform redefining music discovery by focusing on what truly matters‚Äîconnecting fans and emerging artists through the universal language of sound. With daily showcases of global talent, we promote music that bridges cultures and fosters meaningful connections, transcending labels, genres, and trends to celebrate the magic of music. Wonder.Space Los Angeles, CA Wonder.Space is the first AI-powered creative network where creators collaborate to produce instant movies. Generate complete movies from prompts, remix other creators' movies and cast characters from across the community. Wonder.Space is where AI meets human creativity, transforming individual storytelling into collaborative moviemaking. Robotics, Web3, Voice & Extended Reality Finalists Airtrek Robotics Covington, KY Airtrek Robotics develops an autonomous robot that cleans airport tarmacs, tackling the $23 billion Foreign Object Debris (FOD) issue. With deep expertise in robotics and AI, especially within airport environments, the team is piloting its solution at multiple airports, paving the way for smarter and safer ground operations. Contoro Austin, TX Contoro Robotics is revolutionizing industrial automation with AI-powered robots, focused on automating the unloading of floor-loaded or non-palletized shipping containers and trailers. Their pioneering human-in-the-loop (HITL) model ensures over 99% success in real-world applications, bridging the gap between AI limitations and the commercial viability of advanced robotics solutions. Fluid Reality Chicago, IL Fluid Reality brings the sense of touch to people in virtual environments. Fingertip haptic ‚Äúdisplays‚Äù imprint high fidelity tactile ‚Äúimages‚Äù on the skin. This allows people to feel and use their hands naturally in XR and teleoperation, and to generate high value spatial data for AI training of robots. MUSE Tokyo, Japan MUSE develops robotics platforms integrating robots and data services to enhance operational efficiency and customer engagement. Our versatile robot, "Armo," handles tasks like inventory transport, shelf scanning, customer guidance, and promotions. The "Eureka Platform" detects stock shortages and shelf discrepancies, ensuring seamless and efficient store operations. Wubble.ai Singapore, Singapore Commercial Music Access is a painful process today - it‚Äôs expensive, mired in red tape, has limited optionality and allows for zero customisation. And that‚Äôs where Wubble comes in. Wubble.ai is the world's first enterprise grade AI solution that empowers businesses, big and small, to create royalty-free, personalised music, in seconds, at a fraction of current costs. The use cases? Marketing and social media videos, retail soundscapes, dynamic gaming soundtracks, training videos...the list goes on. With our clients including the likes of Disney, NBC Universal, Spotify, Starbucks and Warner Discovery, we are just getting started. Alternates Code19 Racing Bloomington, IN Founded by military veterans and a crack team of autonomy experts, Code19 Racing leverages the track as a proving ground for autonomous innovation, refining systems for real-world, dual-use applications for those who need it most while inspiring the next generation of STEM leaders. Gemma Robotics New York, NY Gemma Robotics is democratizing the delight of celebrity-quality makeup application. We are combining the worlds of deep tech and beauty to make confidence convenient by delivering a full face of tailored makeup in mere minutes. Using advanced robotics, touchless airbrush technology, and an intuitive app, Gemma brings effortless beauty to users in the home and on-the-go. Glydr Plano, TX Glydr is building an innovative and revolutionary foot-based controller for games, VR, and much more. Glydr improves performance and relieves strain on overstretched hands and fingers. Glydr is also ideal for gamers with disabilities. HealthTech, MedTech, BioTech & Accessibility Finalists Glidance Seattle, WA At Glidance, we‚Äôre on a mission to transform independent mobility for people who are blind or have low vision through Glide‚Äîthe first AI-powered, ground-connected, self-guided mobility aid designed to empower millions more people with unparalleled confidence and independence. Intero Biosystems Ann Arbor, MI Intero Biosystems develops human stem cell-derived mini-organs to transform preclinical testing, accelerating the discovery of safer, more effective drugs before they reach human trials. NerView Surgical Ontario, Canada NerView Surgical aims to reduce accidental nerve injuries during surgery. Inspired by Parikh‚Äôs experience with his grandfather‚Äôs nerve injury, our novel contactless imaging technology helps surgeons identify nerves, avoid unintended damage, and improve patient outcomes. Our vision is to become the standard of care for surgical nerve visualization. Somnair Baltimore, MD Somnair is a medical device developing the first non-invasive neurostimulation device for the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea, a disease that affects 54 million Americans and 1 billion people around the world. Vocxi Health Arden Hills, MN Vocxi Health detects diseases through a simple 1-minute mobile AI-enabled breath test. The sensor technology behind the platform has 40 granted patents. The team who invented the technology has commercialized dozens of medical technologies. The technology platform measures thousands of exhaled chemical biomarkers (volatile organic compounds) produced by the body. Alternates Audiom Gilroy, CA Audiom by XR Navigation is a digital map viewer and editor accessible visually, auditorily, and textually, benefiting users across all abilities. It can supplement or fully replace existing geographic maps, ensuring compliance with accessibility standards, and enriches maps for data analytics and navigation through enhanced inclusivity in various settings. Bia Sleep Vancouver, Canada We have built a smart sleep mask that acts like an Autopilot for your brain. We use Neurotechnology (fNIRS) to look at where you are now - ie. your current pin - then guide you with audio and light to where you need to go (Neurofeedback) - ie. your destination: optimal sleep. CODA Tel Aviv, Israel CODA is an AI-powered interactive communication avatar translating spoken language into sign language. Inspired by the Deaf parents of its female co-founders, CODA empowers the Deaf community with independence while helping businesses expand their audience and enhance services through inclusive technology. Innovative World Tech Finalists ChakraTech San Diego, CA ChakraTech‚Äînamed after the Sanskrit word chakra, meaning circle‚Äîpioneers biotech and cleantech innovations for sustainable manufacturing. Using ancient microbes, we transform waste greenhouse gases into biomaterials that replace fossil-fuel based plastics. Our approach tackles plastic pollution and the microplastics crisis while also providing a novel solution to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Expanso Seattle, WA Expanso is a leading distributed computing company founded by industry experts with deep experience in distributed systems, container orchestration, and enterprise operations. The team has a proven track record of building platforms used by Google, Amazon, and Microsoft, and their platform Bacalhau already sees over 10,000 monthly downloads. FastSense Tel Aviv, Israel Fast Sense is a hydrogen molecule management company that quantifies what's in your gas or liquid through a mult-pixel semiconductor chip for the energy sector. We Hear You St. Louis, MO We Hear You specializes in accessibility solutions, led by the Hero Door Opener: a portable, cost-effective device that automates any door without hardwiring. Compatible with voice activation, personal remotes, and wall buttons, the Hero enhances mobility and accessibility for individuals with disabilities, the immunocompromised, and anyone needing hands-free access. Xatoms Toronto, Canada Xatoms leverages its patented quantum chemistry and AI technology to discover new photocatalytic materials capable of purifying water from the world's toughest contaminants using sunlight. With pilot projects across Africa and Indigenous communities in Canada, Xatoms is a leader in the photocatalytic discovery space. Alternates Carrot Miami, FL Carrot is a ClimateTech platform building the world‚Äôs first green commodities market to accelerate decarbonization and waste reduction at scale. Using AI and blockchain, Carrot tracks and certifies recycling and carbon credits, empowering businesses, communities, and supply chains to drive measurable impact toward a resource-efficient, low-carbon, and inclusive circular economy. Sigen AI Vancouver, Canada Sigen AI is opening up a previously untapped and infinite video data source ‚Äì corporate CCTV video footage. Our technology converts this footage into a monetizable asset, which could be used for deep insights or sold as a data set for the AI sector. Recant.Ai Perth, Australia Recant.ai is elevating decorum in our online conversations by altering the incentives for positive interactions and holding to account those who violate others. Security, GovTech & Space Finalists Charter Los Angeles, CA Charter is building the infrastructure technology to financialize the space industry and underwrite the entire space economy. With Ubik, Charter‚Äôs platform for spacecraft manufacturing, we accelerate engineering by 2x, and we‚Äôre the first-in-the-world to enable space asset insurance through data-driven underwriting in partnership with the world‚Äôs leading insurers. Hyphen Innovations Dayton, OH Hyphen Innovations is a startup from an Air Force entrepreneur program focused on R&D that makes space, defense, and aerospace parts better. Key activities include creating test devices, damage free parts, and manufacturing processes. Promising products from the R&D are i-DAMP designs for engines and accelerated testing for manufacturing qualifications. LifeKnight Traverse City, MI LifeKnight is an AI-powered safety platform revolutionizing emergency detection & response. Our flagship LOIS Safety App delivers seamless, automated protection, integrating health monitoring and workplace safety to save lives and enhance security worldwide. Little Place Labs Houston, TX Little Place Labs leverages advanced space edge computing and machine learning on satellites to deliver near-real-time insights for applications like asset monitoring, disaster detection, and maritime surveillance. Trusted by the US Air Force, we empower decision-makers with precise, timely data for critical missions. Verisoul Austin, TX Verisoul helps companies automate fake account and fraud detection throughout the entire user journey. We secure the integrity of online accounts, interactions, and transactions for businesses worldwide. Alternates Elodin San Francisco, CA Unified flight software and hardware are needed for tomorrow's mission. Rarefied Sommerville, MA Rarefied is a Harvard University spin-out developing technology that enables lightweight platforms to levitate indefinitely in near-space (30‚Äì100 km altitudes) using only sunlight. As the first solution capable of sustained flight at these altitudes, we‚Äôre opening new frontiers for weather monitoring, telecommunications, and defense applications with unmatched sustainability. Tempesst Droneworx Houston, TX Tempest Droneworx is a service-disabled Veteran owned software company whose mission is to prevent issues from becoming serious problems via early warning. Our Harbinger software fuses agnostic sources of data, providing real-time contextual intelligence that is shared simultaneously across organizations, reducing time to decision and speeding time to action. Smart Cities, Transportation & Sustainability Finalists Carbon Negative Solutions Portland, OR Carbon Negative Solutions remediates air and ground pollution for industrial companies, converting these waste streams into carbon-negative cement supplements (SCMs). Our technology enables industrial companies to turn their expensive waste into money making assets all while decarbonizing two hard-to-abate industries simultaneously. Helix Earth Houston, TX Commercial air conditioning uses antiquated and power-hungry technology, producing more carbon emissions than the aviation industry. Helix Earth is adapting tech we created for NASA space missions to build a retrofit device that improves commercial rooftop AC efficiency and lowers your power bill by up to 50%. Importal Austin, TX Importal is an AI-powered trade compliance platform that empowers companies to seamlessly and compliantly import goods into the United States. Our automated solution eliminates costly errors, expedite clearance, and ensure compliance‚Äîhelping businesses reduce risk, save time, and scale confidently in a competitive market. Emobi San Francisco, CA Emobi is the leading EV charging digital infrastructure that delivers a single point of integration to a vast network of charging stations and e-mobility partners through its advanced AI and data refinement models. The company enables traditional and streamlined (JustPlug) Plug & Charge technology, facilitating automatic charging identification between EVs and chargers. Tern AI Austin, TX Tern AI is building the future of positioning, where figuring out where we are doesn‚Äôt require a trip to space. Our patented IDPS enables accurate navigation without satellites‚Äîeasy to install, update, and interference-resistant. It remains dependable in the most challenging locations and without signal, ensuring safer navigation wherever you travel. Alternates Sluicebox San Francisco, CA Building the technical infrastructure to accelerate the green transition for the $2T electronic value chain. Velo AI Pittsburgh, PA Our mission at Velo AI is to improve road safety by addressing the alarming surge in bicyclist fatalities and injuries over the past decade. Our first product, Copilot, constantly watches the road and alerts both bicyclists and vehicle drivers about potential hazards, to stop crashes before they occur. Student Startups Finalists MabLab Boston, MA MabLab is a healthcare startup based at Harvard University building rapid tests to screen for laced drugs and spiked drinks. After losing a close friend to the overdose crisis, our mission is to revolutionize personal safety with a life-saving solution that detects the presence of dangerous lacing agents before tragedy strikes. MyEndoscope Tokyo, Japan We develop MyEndoscope, a portable endoscopic training system combining a VR simulation app and a Bluetooth-enabled controller. Designed for accessibility and efficiency, it empowers endoscopists and healthcare professionals worldwide to practice anytime, anywhere, enhancing skills, improving patient safety, and addressing training gaps in global healthcare systems. The Dev Difference Chicago, IL The Dev Difference is an AI mock interview platform that helps candidates practice their communication and technical skills, get instant feedback, and grow confidence to land high-quality roles in tech. Our goal is to level the playing field of interviews to see a more representative and equitable workforce in tech. The Flossy Organization Brooklyn, NY Closing the advocacy gap in marginalized communities through intergenerational civics training, tech and grassroots mobilization. Vocadian Boston, MA A health tech venture building predictive fatigue risk management for safer, healthier, and more productive frontline workforces. Our voice AI-powered software serves safety-critical industries including transportation, mining, construction, aviation, and insurance across LATAM and US. We help organizations reduce risks, protect workers, and foster a culture of trust and well-being. Alternates BRCE Detroit, MI BRCƒí develops advanced athletic gear using proprietary composite materials to enhance performance, safety, and recovery. FindRX Boston, MA FindRx is a cutting-edge healthcare solution dedicated to addressing medication shortages, including ADHD treatments and diabetic injections. Leveraging deep clinical expertise and innovative strategies, FindRx reliably supports patients and institutions. By expanding into data services, it provides real-time pharmacy inventory analytics, enabling institutions to make strategic, data-driven business decisions. RevcoEnergy Austin, TX RevcoEnergy is a sustainable, grid-optional energy provider. We provide easily deployable solar power systems with integrated battery storage and EV charging capabilities. Our vision is to offer alternative power sources that are both powerful in the energy they provide while simultaneously ensuring they are sustainable and inclusive. Shalanda Armstrong 100KM Ventures Washington, DC Sean Branagan Newhouse School at Syracuse University Syracuse, NY Karla Brottlier Velveteen Ventures Seattle, WA Lisa Burton HearstLab Austin, TX Noramay Cadena Supply Change Capital Los Angeles, CA Dr. Paul Campbell Brown Venture Group St. Paul, MN Tipatat Chennavasin The Venture Reality Fund San Francisco, CA Bryony Cooper PT1 Berlin, Germany Brian Dixon Kapor Capital Oakland, CA Ester Dyson EdVentures Holding New York, NY Marcos Fernandez Fiat Ventures San Francisco, CA Kelley Ford Edison Partners Nashville, TN Gail Christine Gannon Esante & UC Berkeley Redwood City, CA Richard Gu March Capital Los Angeles, CA Arthur Gushiken SoftBank Miami, FL Arlan Hamilton Backstage Capital Los Angeles, CA Mohanjit Jolly Iron Pillar Palo Alto, CA Mo Jomaa CapitalG San Fransisco, CA Anil Joshi Unicorn India Ventures Mumbai, Maharashtra George Kellerman Woven Capital Tokyo, Japan Kay Koplovitz Springboard Enterprises/USA Networks New York, NY Angelica Maestas SevenFive Ventures Albuquerque, NM Akif Malik PodiumVC San Francisco, CA Suprett Maestas Raiven Capital Palo Alto, CA Brett Martin Charge Ventures/Fonzi.ai New York, NY Jesse Martinez invincible Houston, TX James Massaquoi Glasswing Ventures Boston, MA Rahul Meka Playground Global Palo Alto, CA Elisa Miller-Out Chloe Capital Ithaca, NY Richard Munassi Tampa Bay Wave Tampa, FL Anu Puvvada KPMG Houston, TX Jessica Robinson Assembly Ventures Detroit, MI David S. Rose Gust New York, NY Amy Salerno Siddhi Capital Boise, ID Lee Shapiro 7wire Ventures Chicago, IL Mike Sherbakov The Veteran Fund San Francisco, CA Rick Spencer Growth Factory Roseville, CA Maggie Sprenger Audere Capital New York, NY Bryan Stubbs Cleveland Water Alliance Cleveland, OH Eli Velasquez Investors of Color Boston, MA Martina Welkhoff WXR Fund Seattle, WA Melissa Withers RevUp Capital Boston, MA Amy Wu Menlo Ventures Brooklyn, NY Pamela York Capita3 Minneapolis, MI The individuals listed below were instrumental to the success of the 2025 SXSW Pitch. Their hard work, diligence, and support in bringing together the technology industry‚Äôs future to our event is greatly appreciated. 2025 Advisory Board The SXSW Pitch Qualifying and Coaches Committee has contributed significantly to its success. The Qualifying Committee focuses on the intake of all plans submitted and is responsible for validating the applications for accuracy, completeness, veracity, and proper categorization. With their vast experience, SXSW Pitch Coaches work closely with the finalists in the months leading up to the event to assist them in their onstage presentations. 2025 Coaches and Qualifiers Each year, PitchBook, a financial data and software company, compiles over a decade‚Äôs worth of data into a report for the SXSW Pitch event. Download the 2024 PitchBook Report SXSW Pitch proudly applauds our alumni and the millions of funding along the way. Over the years, we launched our startup platform for finalists with great ideas with the goal of matching them with top investors both nationally and internationally. Of the 647 companies that participated in SXSW Pitch between 2009 and 2024, over 93% received funding, with a combined funding of over $23.2 billion. Of these 647 companies, 17% have been acquired by companies including Google, British Telecom, Huffington Post, Apple, Live Nation, OpenTable, Meta, Michelin, Constant Contact, and Harmon. Some of our prestigious alumni include Klout, ICON, Hipmunk, Wildfire, Tubemogul, Siri, Foodspotting, and Tango. items.title: SXSW Expo | SXSW Conference & Festivals
items.description: The SXSW Expo highlights the integrations and overlaps between SXSW's converging industries, hosting a diverse range of forward-thinking exhibitors.
items.content: SXSW Expo March 9-12, 2025 | 9:00am - 4:00pm Discover industry disruptors, creative innovators, technological masterpieces and more at the SXSW Expo. 2025 Exhibitor List View the Show Floor Creative Industries Expo ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Oscar Moreno The SXSW Expo is the convergence of all industries on the cutting-edge of technology, design, social good, entertainment, health + wellness, and more. Mindfully curated, SXSW spends the year searching for brands, services and products that will take attendees into the 22nd century and beyond. Hundreds of exhibitors from across the globe meet under one roof to ignite passions, collaborate and share groundbreaking discoveries. The SXSW Expo is open to all badgeholders, open to the public for Austin Industry Day on March 12th. Innovation The Innovation pavilion is a collection of disruptors and thought leaders at the forefront of their industry. Focusing on the diverse and dynamic trends defining tomorrow‚Äôs technologies, creative pursuits, and more, these exhibitors are paving the way for the future. Global The Global Pavilion explores the full spectrum of worldwide initiatives, trends, creators, and tastemakers. Attendees explore ideas from across the globe in a hands-on environment and walk away with heightened insight into where international industries are headed. Social Impact The Social Impact Pavilion concentrates on businesses that have implemented or built initiatives to secure a more positive impact socially, economically, and environmentally. These companies are providing long-lasting solutions that improve lives and the world around us. Health + Wellness The Health & Wellness Pavilion features companies looking to improve a person's quality of life through various products, services, and ideas. Brought together by a common goal these exhibitors should be on a mission to make the world healthier, happier, and more balanced. Entertainment The Entertainment Pavilion showcases exhibitors on the cutting-edge of industries like film, music, gaming and more. From designers and developers to artists and coders, these trailblazers continue to capture the attention of the masses. Next Stage The Next Stage brings together the most engaging discussions and ideas from our exhibiting brands, connecting attendees with innovative new ways to do business. Session speakers will share their knowledge and experience in new ways, with a focus on ideas that are shaping their industries. Podcast Lounge The SXSW Expo Podcast Lounge is home to unique podcasts from varying genres centered on conference programming including social good, gaming, music, film, technology, and more. Networking Lounge The Networking Lounge serves as the ideal space for SXSW attendees to meet with other industry professionals, friends, and colleagues. An expo hot spot, this area fosters meaningful interactions in an environment of collaboration and creativity. The Hub The Hub is the go-to space to lounge, charge your phone, and catch up on emails while watching simulcasts of Featured and Keynote speakers. The Q&A Stage The Q&A Stage is the ultimate destination for unscripted sessions with notable industry experts. This unique format allows registrants to engage directly with speakers, gaining insights and answers on a wide range of topics. Contact Us to Exhibit Interested in exhibiting at SXSW? Fill out the form to get in touch with a SXSW representative. Contact Us Register for SXSW 2025 Experience unparalleled discovery at SXSW 2025 from March 7-15 in Austin, TX. Secure your SXSW Badge today! Learn More Flatstock XR Experience Conference Festivals Conference Sponsors Stay Tuned Sign up to receive the latest announcements, tips, networking invitations and more.

items.title: SXSW XR Experience
items.description: SXSW XR Experience features live panels, performances, and more. Join us in person at the XR Experience Exhibition or virtually via VRChat.
items.content: XR Experience Exhibition March 9‚Äì11, 2025 | 11:00am - 6:00pm Explore the latest immersive art from some of the most creative minds in the world at the SXSW XR Experience. 2025 Exhibitor List View the Show Floor XR Experience ‚Äì SXSW 2024 ‚Äì Photo by Tico Mendoza Where the SXSW Film & TV Festival and Exhibitions meet, the SXSW XR Experience will once again bring the most exciting creators working between technology and art to Austin. The SXSW XR Experience is supported by Taiwan Creative Content Agency Creators working in immersive art are constantly pushing the boundaries of how new technology can bring their work to life. Take a walk through cutting edge physical and virtual installations and find your next favorite artists in the XR Experience. This exhibition is open to all badge holders, and located at the Fairmont (101 Red River St, Austin, TX 78701). The Fairmont is located next to the Austin Convention Center with a convenient walkway between the two spaces. Subscribe to Event Updates and the community newsletters to stay in the SX know. The immersive arts are finding new ways to enhance our ability to perceive the world that surrounds us, and in many instances they are redefining how we experience the world. The projects presented in our XR Experience emphasize ingenuity, storytelling, and also showcase how other industries are embracing this new medium. XR Experience Competition World Premieres of exciting, immersive, reality-bending work. XR Experience Spotlight Shining a spotlight on acclaimed immersive projects from around the world. XR Experience Special Events One-of‚Äìa-kind events not to be missed! Contact Us to Exhibit Interested in exhibiting at SXSW? Fill out the form to get in touch with a SXSW representative. Contact Us Stay in the SX Know Subscribe to SXSW newsletters to get important event updates on announcements and opportunities across the Conference, Film & TV, and Music communities.
